Title: Data Science and AI Expert
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe‚Äôs leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let‚Äôs shape it together.

Job Description

Are you passionate about using data science and AI to real-world problems? At Sopra Steria, we‚Äôre looking for an experienced and versatile professional to help lead the design and delivery of advanced analytics and AI solutions across a wide range of domainssuch as public services, utilities, healthcare, mobility, and beyond.

In this role, you will work on impactful projects from ideation to delivery. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with both technical and business stakeholders transforming challenges into actionable insights and production-ready solutions. Whether it‚Äôs designing an optimization algorithm, building an LLM-based assistant, or delivering a forecasting pipeline, you‚Äôll help clients unlock value from data.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who combines deep technical expertise with the maturity to take ownership, work autonomously, and guide teams and clients through the ever-evolving AI landscape.

Qualifications

We‚Äôre seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries of digital transformation with AI. If you recognize yourself in most of the following, we‚Äôd love to talk:


You have at least 5 years of experience in delivering real-world AI and data science solutions in production environments.
You are proficient in Python and comfortable with frameworks like scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
You have practical experience with machine learning, and ideally exposure to domains like natural language processing, computer vision, predictive analytics, LLM‚Äôs or optimization.
You‚Äôve worked with at least one major cloud provider (Azure, AWS, or GCP), and understand how to bring models into production securely and efficiently.
You understand how to balance model performance with business relevance, and how to translate analytical outcomes into actionable results.
You enjoy working in a team, guiding junior colleagues, and collaborating with clients to define solution architectures and technical roadmaps.
You‚Äôre comfortable interacting with stakeholders and can communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively.
Experience in project ownership, technical leadership, or contributing to AI strategies.
You are fluent in English, and speak either Dutch or French.


What We Can Offer You


A key role in one of Europe‚Äôs leading digital transformation companies, where innovation meets real-world impact.
The opportunity to work on high-impact projects in AI and advanced analytics across industries and public institutions.
A culture of collaboration and continuous learning, supported by an expert network of consultants, architects, and engineers.
Access to our Sopra Steria Academy, with a wide range of training opportunities and certifications.
A hybrid and flexible working model, with access to offices across Belgium.
Career development opportunities both locally and internationally, within a growing Data & AI practice.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe‚Äôs Leading Digital Service Provider.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A company car or mobility budget
Laptop, phone & phone subscription
A competitive salary and indefinite contract
Insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development


People are the cornerstone of our success. That‚Äôs why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!‚ÄØ

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description:
The Bit About Urbantz:




At Urbantz, we help the world‚Äôs largest retail, grocery, e-commerce and logistics companies love their last mile with a smarter, greener approach to delivery management. Our SaaS platform was built specifically for enterprises to help them cut through the complexity of multi-fleet operations and drive greater sustainability in the final mile at any scale.




More than 100 brands enjoy the clarity and control to cut their CO2 emissions, allocate smartly across carriers, build unique workflows and ensure on-brand delivery experiences for recipients with Urbantz.




Since our inception in 2015, we‚Äôve enjoyed phenomenal growth across Europe, the Middle East and beyond. In 2020, Deloitte ranked us third in its annual Technology Fast 50 list.




The Challenge:




Orchestrating the delivery of thousands and thousands of packages daily is no small feat. It gets even more interesting if you ship from multiple locations, time-slot restrictions, zero-emission zones, and a mixed fleet of bicycles, electric and carbon fuelled vehicles ... Our customers count on us not only to keep track of their deliveries but also to deliver them in the most optimal way.




As a Data Scientist, you'll mine through data and build algorithms that help our customers to operate efficient and sustainable last-mile operations.




The Day-to-Day:




Together with the product management team you identify opportunities to improve our customers Last Mile operations.
You mine route planning and tracking data, research algorithms and design new models.
Together with the software engineering teams, you implement end-to-end solutions and launch them in production.
You develop mechanisms to assess the performance of models and algorithms both offline, using historical data or simulations, and online in production environments.




The Must Haves:




Master's degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics or Machine Learning.
A positive mindset and like to find ways to constantly improve in what you do.
You can build a plan to iteratively deliver larger initiatives and organize the work to be done.
Experience in data mining tools and Python programming language.
Hands-on experience in solving Optimization problems and building Machine Learning models.
Proficient in English.




The Great to Haves:




Three years of experience in a similar role
You have prior experience or interest in solving complex mathematical problems in Supply Chain or similar domain.
Previous experience in Network Simulation (Discrete Event Simulation) is desirable but not mandatory.




The Perks:




Work where you choose: our fancy offices in the center of Brussels, your spare bedroom, a cabin in the woods‚Ä¶ you decide.
Autonomy to define and navigate your own path to success.
A competitive salary, the right tools and a range of fringe benefits depending on your country location.
An incredibly diverse international team and a company culture that encourages freedom, creativity and collaboration.
Opportunities to grow your expertise through training, workshops and conferences.
Team meetups in Brussels, an annual offsite somewhere sunny.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist- Generative AI
Description:
AI Data Scientist ‚Äì Generative AI Focus

We are seeking a talented AI Data Scientist for our client, who possess a strong business mindset and deep expertise in Generative AI. This role offers the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment where analytical skills are applied to solve real business challenges.

Contract duration: 2 year contract.

Location: Brussels - Hybrid

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with business and technical teams to identify high-impact use cases for Generative AI
Design, develop, and implement AI-driven solutions using internal and external data sources
Extract and communicate insights from data to support decision-making
Work with cross-functional teams to resolve data-related issues
Monitor AI models for accuracy and address data drift and discrepancies
Contribute to the development of a GenAI capability framework and internal best practices

Required Skills and Experience:

Proven experience in AI/GenAI delivery, including POCs, pilots, and industrialization
Strong knowledge of data science, including data wrangling, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and machine learning
Proficiency in Python and libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn
Expertise in cloud platforms, especially Azure (Azure AI services, Azure ML, Databricks, Azure OpenAI)
Familiarity with LLM libraries such as Langchain, LangGraph, Promptflow, Semantic Kernel, and Autogen
Experience with LLMOps, CI/CD pipelines, GitHub workflows, and monitoring tools like Weights & Biases
Strong project management skills including collaboration, communication, stakeholder engagement, and strategic oversight

Language requirements:

Professional speaking and writing in skills in French, Dutch and English.

Interested:

connect with me or click apply now.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
CluePoints is a fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Quality Management and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products utilize advanced statistical and machine learning algorithms to assess the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. At CluePoints, we are looking for people with fresh ideas to keep developing our algorithms and help us to sustain our growth.




Responsibilities

As a member of our Research team:

You develop new machine learning models to enhance the CluePoints web platform and/or to develop new products.
You identify promising ML techniques from scientific literature and assess their viability
You leverage relevant open-source resources and keep yourself up-to-date to new developments in this area
You produce robust and clean python code
You follow ML best practices to keep track of experiments and models
You identify new fields of applications for machine learning and deep learning within CluePoints and contribute to increased adoption of machine learning within the healthcare industry
You stay on the edge of relevant research and help CluePoints to continue increasing its scientific visibility by participating at scientific conferences and publishing in scientific journals




Main Qualifications

Master or PhD in Computer sciences or quantitative fields (maths, physics, ...)
Professional experience in machine learning / data science
Efficient in Python
Good knowledge in at least one deep learning platform like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Experience with code versioning tools such as Git




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with deep learning and natural language Processing
Experience in supporting deployments of machine learning models
Experience with medical data
Experience in GPU computing




Top reasons to work with us:

Flexibility is part of our DNA and you‚Äôll find at CluePoints you can work 100% from home or choose to come to the office any day (please note that this point only concerns employees located in our office in Belgium).
If you choose to come to the office, you‚Äôll discover a fun atmosphere including a game room (e.g., withkicker, PS4, arcade machine, nerf battles, and our newly added dartboard).
Many activities are organized during the year, such as soccer, team lunches, happy hours, LAN parties, board games nights! We also have running groups, languages lessons, and much more!
You‚Äôll be working within a squad organization offering you ownership on projects, and utilize high quality equipment like powerful laptops and screens.
At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you‚Äôll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
You‚Äôll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
You‚Äôll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards!
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits, company car, bonus potential, employee referral program.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Freelance Machine Learning Engineer




Location: Brussels

Type: Freelance (Daily Rate)

Duration: 6 Months, with potential extension

Start Date: ASAP




Montash has partnered with a leading organisation to deliver production-ready AI solutions, and we‚Äôre now looking to engage a freelance AI/ML Engineer with a strong focus on industrialising machine learning pipelines.




The Role:

As an AI/ML Engineer, you‚Äôll act as the bridge between Data Science and IT Production, ensuring that ML models are not only functional but fully integrated, monitored, and scalable in a production environment.




Key Responsibilities:

Build and automate robust ML pipelines ready for production deployment
Collaborate closely with Data Scientists to translate models into scalable solutions
Support deployment with CI/CD pipelines, containerisation (Docker/Kubernetes), and infrastructure alignment
Ensure continuous monitoring, retraining, and version control of models in live environments
Drive integration of AI services with appropriate data flow, ingestion, and real-time architecture




Required Experience:

3+ years in ML engineering or related production environments
Strong hands-on skills with Python (incl. async programming & optimisation)
Experience with Linux, Docker, Kubernetes, GitLab CI/CD, and PostgreSQL
Knowledge of AI platforms, Spark, ELT/ETL tools, and data visualisation is a plus
Agile mindset with strong communication skills and stakeholder awareness
Fluent in English and ideally Dutch/French




Interested?

If you're immediately available and this sounds like the right fit, please get in touch today with your CV and availability to shaip@montash.nl

HTML:
Freelance Machine Learning Engineer


Location: Brussels

Type: Freelance (Daily Rate)

Duration: 6 Months, with potential extension

Start Date: ASAP


Montash has partnered with a leading organisation to deliver production-ready AI solutions, and we‚Äôre now looking to engage a freelance AI/ML Engineer with a strong focus on industrialising machine learning pipelines.


The Role:

As an AI/ML Engineer, you‚Äôll act as the bridge between Data Science and IT Production, ensuring that ML models are not only functional but fully integrated, monitored, and scalable in a production environment.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Build and automate robust ML pipelines ready for production deployment
  • Collaborate closely with Data Scientists to translate models into scalable solutions
  • Support deployment with CI/CD pipelines, containerisation (Docker/Kubernetes), and infrastructure alignment
  • Ensure continuous monitoring, retraining, and version control of models in live environments
  • Drive integration of AI services with appropriate data flow, ingestion, and real-time architecture


Required Experience:

  • 3+ years in ML engineering or related production environments
  • Strong hands-on skills with Python (incl. async programming & optimisation)
  • Experience with Linux, Docker, Kubernetes, GitLab CI/CD, and PostgreSQL
  • Knowledge of AI platforms, Spark, ELT/ETL tools, and data visualisation is a plus
  • Agile mindset with strong communication skills and stakeholder awareness
  • Fluent in English and ideally Dutch/French


Interested?

If you're immediately available and this sounds like the right fit, please get in touch today with your CV and availability to shaip@montash.nl

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Als ervaren data scientist puur je relevante inzichten uit de grote hoeveelheid data waarover Colruyt Group beschikt. Je maakt machine learning modellen voor onze verschillende retailmerken. Het resultaat van jouw werk: een nog betere dienstverlening op maat van onze klanten.




Wat doe je concreet?

In de divisie Data & Analytics werk je in een multidisciplinair team bestaande uit data science engineers, data analysten, bi engineers, business analysts, ‚Ä¶ Samen bieden jullie analytische oplossingen aan voor de verschillende Colruyt Group merken, zoals Colruyt Laagste Prijs, Okay, Bike-Republic of Jims. In de data science kennisgroep worden ervaringen en kennis uitgewisseld. Op deze manier blijf je bijleren.
Als data scientist werk je samen met complementaire collega‚Äôs aan een brede waaier van projecten waarbij je in aanraking komt met nieuwe technieken en technologie√´n (bv: Polars, lightgbm, pytorch, uv, kedro, ruff). Daarnaast werken we ook met cutting edge in-house technologie zoals onze eigen forecast module of causaliteitsmodule. We moedigen je ook aan om zelf, in overleg met het team, op zoek te gaan naar nieuwe methoden en technieken en zo de kennis en skills van de groep te vergroten.
Het team focust op onze interne klanten, de business-partners. We vertalen hun noden in analytische oplossingen die we bouwen in multidisciplinaire teams. Dat resulteert in een directe en nauwe samenwerking met IT en business.
We zijn verantwoordelijk voor de identificatie van nieuwe analytics-opportuniteiten. We gaan proactief op zoek naar nieuwe inzichten die een toegevoegde waarde cre√´ren voor onze partners. Daarbij kijken we uiteraard niet alleen naar Colruyt Group, maar volgen we ook de externe trends op het vlak van use cases rond analytics en technologische innovatie.
Colruyt Group bestaat uit veel verschillende entiteiten. Dat zorgt voor een enorme variatie en hoeveelheid aan data √©n use cases. De projecten waar je aan meewerkt gaan dan ook van klantensegmentatie over verkoopsprognose en analyse van winkeltesten tot operationele effici√´ntie van machines, predictive maintenance en optimaal gebruik van grondstoffen.




Je werkt in Halle en kan tot drie dagen per week thuiswerken.







Profiel

Ervaring ‚Äì Je behaalde een master in handelsingenieur, computerwetenschappen, statistiek, wiskunde,... Je hebt minstens 3 tot 5 jaar relevante ervaring.
Kennis statistische modellering ‚Äì Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van machine learning en statistische modellering en kan deze implementeren in Python. Je hebt een goede kennis van SQL en datavisualisatie-technieken.
Analytisch vermogen ‚Äì Je slaagt erin om data te vertalen naar inzichten en je kan die ook helder en duidelijk communiceren.
Talenkennis ‚Äì Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van het Engels en een goede kennis van het Nederlands.







Wij bieden

Stimulerende werkomgeving ‚Äì Je belandt in een ongelooflijk boeiende en rijke data-omgeving, krijgt ruimte voor initiatief en krijgt een brede kijk op het bedrijf.
Permanente leermogelijkheden ‚Äì Naast een heel ruim aanbod aan interne opleidingen krijg je ook de kans om aanvullende opleidingstrajecten te volgen. Op die manier bouw je continu aan je business-kennis, je technische skills en je sociale vaardigheden.
Aantrekkelijk loonpakket ‚Äì Je krijgt een competitief loon met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, winstdeelname en maaltijdcheques.




Bij Colruyt Group kan je anders werken. Jij staat als mens centraal en dat merk je meteen. Zo kan je je vaardigheden scherpstellen dankzij onze ontwikkelingsgerichte aanpak en intern doorgroeien als je dat wilt. Of je nu analist, winkelmedewerker, marketeer of technieker bent, bij ons vind je vast een job die perfect bij je past.

Colruyt Group gelooft in de kracht van diversiteit, gelijkwaardigheid en inclusie. Iedereen is welkom om te solliciteren bij Colruyt Group en we bieden iedereen gelijke kansen.

Title: Data Science Lead, Research Analytics
Description:
Make your mark for patients

We are looking for a Data Science Lead, Research Analytics who is creative, curious, and collaborative in our Global Data Science & Analytics team, based in our Brussel office in Belgium OR Slough.




About The Role

As a Data Science Lead in Research Analytics, you‚Äôll drive analytics solutions that inform compound and antibody discovery for early drug platforms. You‚Äôll apply data science and machine learning to diverse datasets‚Äîimaging, gene expression, high-throughput screens, and sequencing (e.g., mRNA display)‚Äîto identify initial hits and establish early structure-activity relationships. Your work supports the organization‚Äôs Digital Business Transformation and spans modalities including small molecules, peptides, biologics, and gene therapy. You‚Äôll collaborate across departments and with external partners, capturing insights for meta-analysis and communicating results within interdisciplinary teams.




Who You‚Äôll Work With

Internally, you will collaborate with relevant stakeholders in function areas such as Discovery Biology, Translational Biology, Computational Chemistry, Protein Sciences and fellow data science teams & IT. Externally, you may work with academic institutions and partner with other biotech or technology companies.




What You‚Äôll Do

Lead platform development of novel modalities such as peptides, impacting therapeutic projects with data-driven insights using analytics and machine learning on high-dimensional datasets conducted with complex biological assays (e.g. next-generation sequencing, cell-based assays, time-series assays, high-content assays, *-omics assays, etc.).
Clear communication of outputs & results from analyses for all relevant stakeholders.
Adapt and design data processes to support the capture and analysis of assay data and metadata and elevate platform data capability.
Develop workflows that can be used by team members for routine data processing and analysis.
Active collaboration with relevant stakeholders in function areas such as Discovery Biology, Translational Biology, Computational Chemistry, Protein Sciences and fellow data science teams & IT.




Interested? For this role we‚Äôre looking for the following education, experience and skills

PhD in biological, chemical, or data science with strong skills & experience in informatics, statistics, or computer science and demonstrated delivery in the life sciences space
8+ years of hands-on experience with data types, file formats, and common metadata used in biology, including high-dimensional experiments such as imaging, or high-throughput experiments such as peptide/biologics display.
8+ of experience with machine learning on large / high dimensional datasets including data manipulation, wrangling, and analytics.
8+ Experience with machine learning on chemical, sequence, and/or biological features.
8+ years of experience with R and/or Python




Preferred

Prior experience in pharmaceutical industry
Experience with programmatic querying of relational or graph databases is desirable (SQL, neo4j, etc.)
Excellent written and oral communication skills demonstrated by publications and conference presentations




Are you ready to ‚Äògo beyond‚Äô to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!

About Us

UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.

Why work with us?

At UCB, we don‚Äôt just complete tasks, we create value. We aren‚Äôt afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected, and has equal opportunities to do their best work. We ‚Äògo beyond‚Äô to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that‚Äôs on our patients, our employees, or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.

UCB is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions will be made without regard to any characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. UCB invites you to voluntarily self-identify during the application process. Provision of self-identification information is entirely voluntary and a decision to provide or not provide such information will not have any effect on your application for employment, your employment with UCB, or otherwise subject you to any adverse treatment. Any information you provide will be considered confidential and will be kept separate from your application and/or personnel file and will only be used in accordance with applicable laws, orders, and regulations.




Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on US-Reasonable_Accommodation@ucb.com for application to US based roles. Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments; we will not be able to support you through this channel.

Description:
About us

We are a global digital transformation consultancy helping organizations harness data and AI to drive innovation and business growth. We deliver end-to-end solutions across industries, combining strategy, technology, and sustainability to create measurable impact.

The role

We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Data & AI Engineer to lead the design and delivery of advanced AI solutions. his can pay up to ‚Ç¨95000 + 13th month + excellent benefits. You‚Äôll guide clients through complex digital transformations, architect scalable AI systems, and mentor junior team members while driving innovation and best practices.

Your impact

Lead end-to-end Data & AI projects, translating business needs into technical solutions
Design and implement scalable AI platforms, including LLMs, ML pipelines, and MLOps
Advise clients on AI strategy and emerging technologies
Collaborate with architects, engineers, and consultants to deliver high-quality solutions
Mentor and coach junior team members, fostering technical excellence

Expertise in Python and experience with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP)
Proven experience architecting scalable AI/ML solutions
Strong strategic thinking and ability to engage senior stakeholders
Excellent communication skills in Dutch and English

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Join ING Belgium‚Äôs Tech BE Department/Channels, where innovation meets impact. Our AI Platform team is on a mission to develop pioneering end-to-end GenAI applications focused on internal tech use cases. We operate in a fast-paced, startup-like environment within a leading financial institution.

What You Will Do

As a DevOps/GenAI Engineer Intern, you‚Äôll be part of a dynamic team working on cutting-edge GenAI projects. You‚Äôll participate in all stages of the software development lifecycle (SDLC), with a strong focus on DevOps and GenAI technologies. Expect to work both independently and collaboratively, gaining hands-on experience with:


Cloud platforms: Azure, GCP, OpenShift
Containerization: Kubernetes, Docker
Programming: Java, Python
LLMs: Gemini and other GenAI tools


What We Are Looking For

We value not only technical curiosity but also strong soft skills like communication, teamwork, and problem-solving. If you're eager to learn and contribute to meaningful projects, this is the place for you.

What You Will Get


Experience in a startup-mode project environment
Exposure to innovative GenAI technologies and cloud platforms
Mentorship and guidance from experienced engineers


, ING Bank

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde Machine Learning Engineer die ons helpt het Innovation Lab bij ACA verder uit te bouwen. Iemand die samen met ons wil groeien!




ACA‚Äôs Innovation Lab is het nieuwe businessconcept van ACA Group. In ons Innovation Lab groeien innovatieve idee√´n uit tot gevalideerde businessconcepten.




Hoe wij (samen)werken?




Omdat wij een relatief nieuw team zijn, hanteren we geen ‚Äòbusiness-as-usual‚Äô proces. We werken in een dynamische omgeving die eigenlijk vergelijkbaar is met een start-up binnen een groter geheel. ACA investeert een substantieel deel van haar winst in het ‚ÄúACA Innovation Lab‚Äù zodat er ruimte is om nieuwe idee√´n en technologie√´n af te toetsen.

We hebben bij ACA gekozen voor een proactieve aanpak om innovatie (AI en Machine Learning) bij onze klanten te stimuleren. Dit heeft ons de kans gegeven om samen met onze klanten een aantal nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen door het gebruik van AI en ML.




Waar jij mee aan zal werken (tech & omgeving)?




Python & Java
Kubernetes & Kubeflow
AWS / GCP
Jupyter notebooks
Git
Tensorflow
Machine Vision toolkits (YOLO, OpenCV, ‚Ä¶)
Wandb
MLFlow




Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze rol?




Hard skills

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.




Soft skills

Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig te werk.
Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!




Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?




Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
We‚Äôve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega‚Äôs gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

Show more

Hard skills

  • Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
  • Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
  • Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
  • Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
  • Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.


Soft skills

  • Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
  • Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig te werk.
  • Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!


Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?


  • Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
  • Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
  • Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
  • We‚Äôve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega‚Äôs gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
  • Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
  • Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

Title: BE-Data Scientist
Description:
Who are we?

Collaboration Betters The World ( CBTW ), is a company providing tech et business solutions to its clients, thanks to its expertise through 9 service lines.

As a Data Scientist, you will join our Data Analytics & AI service line, where we are supporting organizations every step of the way to become data-driven.

Responsibilities

What is your role?

You will be part of a journey where you will have two impacts: a client impact and an internal impact. For the internal impact, based on your skills and time, you will be joining our internal data community at CBTW, to share knowledge and best practices. For the client impact, tasks can vary depending on the client and the project, but as a Data Engineer, you will mainly:


Mining both structured and unstructured data to identify patterns and provide information through predictive models
Explore and collect data from multiple sources to apply or develop analytical ad statistical methods and machine learning models
Apply statistics and machine learning algorithms to discover patterns in datasets


Qualifications

What is your profile?

You


Have at least a bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, statistics, economics or in another relevant field
Have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar role
Know technologies such as Python, Tensorflow, Pandas, Numpy SQL, Random Forest, neural networks, etc.
Speak English, Dutch and French
Will be an outstanding candidate if you share our values: Positive Thinking, Collaboration, Evolution & Commitment.


What are we offering?

Evolution


Personal follow-up during your career at CBTW and buddy-ship program during your first 6 months
Catalogue with a wide variety of trainings for hard- and soft skills, private language classes, unlimited access to an E-learning platform (Udemy, O'reilly,‚Ä¶) and possibility to get certified every year (Azure, AWS, Prince2, etc.)


Collaboration


On top of the data community, you can join one of the passion communities and practice your hobby or share your interests with other positive thinkers
International collaboration, possibility to work worldwide


On Top Of That


Competitive salary with a flexible mobility package (variety of choice between electrical cars, electrical bikes, payment of rent/mortgage...)
You will become part of a growing team of people keen on applying the latest technologies and knowledge. You will be able to work in a dynamic, innovating environment with the proper touch of geekiness and yearning for board games.


Do you see a match? We would love to see your application coming in! üòâ

Title: AI-Engineer
Description:
LACO is een toonaangevend data-intelligentiebedrijf met meer dan 35 jaar expertise in data engineering, analytics en AI. Wij helpen organisaties bij het omzetten van data in waardevolle inzichten en ondersteunen hen in hun digitale transformatie.




Wat ga je doen?

Als AI-Engineer ben jij de technische spil in het ontwikkelen en implementeren van AI-oplossingen op het Azure-platform. Je werkt nauw samen met data scientists, data engineers en softwareontwikkelaars om schaalbare en betrouwbare AI-modellen te bouwen, finetunen en integreren in de productie omgeving.




Je bent verantwoordelijk voor:

Het deployen van machine learning modellen via Azure Machine Learning.
Het ontwikkelen van pipelines voor data-inname, modeltraining en deployment (CI/CD).
Het monitoren, bijsturen en onderhouden van AI-oplossingen in productie.
Het toepassen van responsible AI-principes zoals fairness, explainability en privacy.
Samenwerken met stakeholders om AI-mogelijkheden om te zetten in waardevolle toepassingen.




Wat neem je mee?

üéì Vereiste vaardigheden en ervaring:

Bachelor of Master in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science of vergelijkbaar.
Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als AI-engineer of ML engineer.
Ervaring met Python en ML-frameworks zoals scikit-learn, TensorFlow of PyTorch.

Aantoonbare ervaring met Microsoft Azure, met name:

Azure Machine Learning (AML)
Azure Data Lake / Data Factory
Azure Cognitive Services
Azure DevOps / GitHub Actions
Azure Kubernetes Services (AKS) voor modeldeployment (pr√©)
Ervaring met MLOps-praktijken: versiebeheer, experimenttracking, pipeline-automatisering.
Begrip van CI/CD, containerisatie (Docker), en infrastructure-as-code (ARM, Bicep of Terraform).
Vaardigheid in het analyseren van modelprestaties en het doorvoeren van verbeteringen.
Sterk analytisch denkvermogen en probleemoplossend vermogen.




Wat bieden wij?

Uitgebreide opleidingsmogelijkheden door ervaren professionals.
Snelle groei binnen een expert-driven omgeving.
Een hecht team met regelmatige kennisdelingssessies en events.
Dynamische bedrijfscultuur: geniet van leuke evenementen zoals een familiedag, jaarlijkse skitrip, sportevents en game nights.
We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.




Interesse?

Klinkt dit als jouw volgende uitdaging? Stuur dan je cv naar careers@laco.be of solliciteer via onze website Working at LACO | LACO.

Title: Expert in AI/ NLP/ ML
Description:
#HumanizingTechnology




ABOUT SEIDOR




At SEIDOR, we help drive the transformation and competitiveness of our clients through technology and innovation, always focusing on the value of the human side and being committed to talent and sustainable development.




We are a diverse and inclusive organization that believes in equal opportunities. We already have over 8,000 professionals in 45 countries across Europe, Latin America, the United States, the Middle East, Africa, and Asia.




Here, you can develop and grow both professionally and personally from day one, with the support of a great team that shares human values.




We carry out projects with a positive impact at both national and international levels, serving clients from different industries and collaborating closely with the leading technology providers (such as SAP, Microsoft, Salesforce, IBM, Google, AWS, Cisco, Adobe). We are one of the most recognized and awarded companies by our partners.




We are committed to sustainability and promote ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) criteria to achieve sustainable development. We have reduced and offset our carbon footprint, becoming a net-zero company.




At SEIDOR, we believe that to address the challenges of the digital world and the new hurdles that arise, we must have the best allies, market-leading technologies, and, above all, the best people.




Will you join us in humanizing technology?




ABOUT THE JOB




We are a large company with a start-up spirit. We organize ourselves into expert knowledge Units that collaborate with each other.




That's why we are looking for curious individuals who are motivated by challenges and eager to grow personally and professionally, to join our team and make a positive impact on the world through technology.




ARE YOU UP FOR THE CHALLENGE?




We want you to be a part of our team, from Brussels, as an Expert in AI/ NLP/ ML.




WHAT WILL YOU DO IN YOUR DAY-TO-DAY?

‚Ä¢ Engaging with Business stakeholders, organising workshops and meetings to gather requirements

‚Ä¢ Analysing needs in the archiving domain and translating them into robust technical specifications

‚Ä¢ Designing and proposing AI- and cloud-based architectures that are secure, scalable, and cost effective

‚Ä¢ Developing, testing, and deploying solutions leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs), vector databases, and orchestration frameworks (e.g., LangChain)

‚Ä¢ Building prototypes, Proofs of Concept, and production-ready services using Python and Jupyter Notebooks

‚Ä¢ Leveraging AWS Cloud Services (e.g., S3, Lambda, SageMaker, Bedrock, API Gateway, ECS/EKS, CloudFormation/Terraform)

‚Ä¢ Preparing and maintaining technical documentation, ensuring knowledge transfer within the team

‚Ä¢ Integrating solutions into existing data and archiving systems

‚Ä¢ Monitoring, optimising, and supporting deployed solutions over time

‚Ä¢ Collaborating closely with Business, IT Infrastructure, and Security teams to ensure long-term sustainability.

WHAT DO WE EXPECT FROM YOU?

Excellent knowledge of LLMs: fine-tuning, prompting strategies, evaluation, and deployment (at least 3 years of experience)
Good knowledge of LangChain or equivalent frameworks for LLM orchestration (at least 2 years of experience)
Good knowledge of vector databases (at least 2 years of experience)
Good knowledge of Python, with practical use of Jupyter Notebooks (at least 2 years of experience)
Good knowledge of AWS services for AI, data, and cloud-native development (at least 2 years of experience)
Experience in machine Learning Operations, including CI/CD pipelines and monitoring of AI solutions (at least 1 year of experience)
Experience in data engineering and archiving best practices (at least 1 year of experience).
Ability to understand, speak and write English (C1 level).

CERTIFICATIONS & STANDARDS:

‚Ä¢ AWS Certified Solutions Architect ‚Äì Professional

‚Ä¢ AWS Certified Machine Learning ‚Äì Specialty

‚Ä¢ AWS Certified DevOps Engineer ‚Äì Professional

‚Ä¢ TensorFlow Developer Certificate or equivalent AI/ML credentials.

‚Ä¢ Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA)

‚Ä¢ TOGAF or equivalent enterprise architecture framework certification

WHAT WILL YOU FIND AT SEIDOR?

A diverse team. We respect the differences that make us more human. üíú
Companionship. We work as a team and learn from each other.
Flexibility and work-life balance. Remote working is in our DNA. We promote flexible working hours and offer shorter working day every Friday, as well as in the months of July and August. üôå
Continuous learning. Language courses, technical training, certifications, and more.
Personalized career development, allowing you to decide where you want to go. üöÄ
Autonomy and the opportunity to suggest and promote new opportunities.
Flexible compensation program. Childcare vouchers, restaurant benefits, transportation, and health insurance.
Exclusive discounts and special conditions on technology, leisure, travel, and more. üåü
You can be part of charitable and environmentally related initiatives.
If you have international interests, we are present in 45 countries. üåç







Join our team and help us humanize the world through technology!

  • Personalized career development, allowing you to decide where you want to go. üöÄ
  • Autonomy and the opportunity to suggest and promote new opportunities.

  • You can be part of charitable and environmentally related initiatives.
  • If you have international interests, we are present in 45 countries. üåç



Join our team and help us humanize the world through technology!

Title: Expert in AI/NLP/ML
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for an Expert in AI/NLP/ML fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either in the company's premises or on-site at the customer's premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated into the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on-site.

Tasks:

    • Engaging with Business stakeholders, organising workshops and meetings to gather requirements;
    • Analysing needs in the archiving domain and translating them into robust technical specifications;
    • Designing and proposing AI- and cloud-based architectures that are secure, scalable, and costeffective;
    • Developing, testing, and deploying solutions leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs), vector databases, and orchestration frameworks (e.g., LangChain);
    • Building prototypes, Proofs of Concept, and production-ready services using Python and Jupyter Notebooks;
    • Leveraging AWS Cloud Services (e.g., S3, Lambda, SageMaker, Bedrock, API Gateway, ECS/EKS, CloudFormation/Terraform);
    • Preparing and maintaining technical documentation, ensuring knowledge transfer within the team;
    • Integrating solutions into existing data and archiving systems;
    • Monitoring, optimising, and supporting deployed solutions over time;
    • Collaborating closely with Business, IT Infrastructure, and Security teams to ensure long-term sustainability.



Requirements

    • Master's degree in IT or a relevant discipline, combined with a minimum of 13 years of relevant working experience in IT;
    • At least 3 years of experience in LLMs: fine-tuning, prompting strategies, evaluation, and deployment;
    • At least 2 years of experience in LangChain or equivalent frameworks for LLM orchestration;
    • At least 2 years of experience in Vector databases;
    • At least 2 years of experience in Python, with practical use of Jupyter Notebooks;
    • At least 2 years of experience in AWS services for AI, data, and cloud-native development;
    • At least 1 year of experience in Machine Learning Operations, including CI/CD pipelines and monitoring of AI solutions;
    • At least 1 year of experience in data engineering and archiving best practices;
    • Good knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes and security best practices in AI and cloud-based deployments would be an advantage;
    • Knowledge of DevOps/Infrastructure-as-Code tools beyond AWS (Terraform, Ansible) and data governance frameworks and compliance standards (e.g., GDPR) would be an advantage;
    • AWS Solutions Architect, AWS Machine Learning, AWS DevOps Engineer, TensorFlow Developer or equivalent AI/ML credentials, Kubernetes Administrator (CKA), TOGAF or equivalent enterprise architecture framework certifications would be an asset;
    • Excellent command of the English language.


Benefits

If you are seeking a career in an exciting, dynamic and multicultural international environment with exciting opportunities that will boost your career, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference (19007/09/2025).

We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

You may also consider all our other open vacancies by visiting the career section of our web site (www.eurodyn.com) and follow us on Twitter (@EURODYN_Careers) and LinkedIn.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (www.eurodyn.com) is a leading European Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Berlin, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Valetta, Vienna, Den Haag, Hong Kong, etc.) The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc). We design and develop software applications using integrated, state-of-the-art technology. Our current IT projects have a value exceeding 300 million EURO. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to European Union Institutions, international organizations, European Agencies and national government Administrations in 40 countries and 4 continents.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, colour, age, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
üöÄ We're Hiring: AI EngineerüöÄ




Location: Fully Remote (EU) | Occasional Travel (Once Every 2 Months)

What You‚Äôll Do:




Design, develop, and deploy advanced AI models and solutions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI into various applications.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe‚Äôs leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let‚Äôs shape it together!

Job Description

We‚Äôre seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!‚ÄØ

You are fully convinced that data science isn‚Äôt a hype, but you also believe that, in order to be valuable and really make a company smarter, it must be done right. Your goal is therefore to create the most impactful solution possible in the quickest and easiest way possible so that real value can be extracted from data and artificial intelligence.‚ÄØ

Qualifications

We‚Äôre looking for someone who has:


A master‚Äôs degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, or a related field.
2 to 4 years of hands-on experience developing and implementing AI/ML models in production environments.
Strong Python programming skills, including experience with API-building frameworks such as FastAPI and prototyping tools like Streamlit.
Experience with machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar is considered a strong asset.
Solid understanding of machine learning including model evaluation techniques and familiarity with advanced applications such as: NLP, forecasting, optimization, computer vision.
Experience in working with cloud-based environments (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and ML pipelines is a strong asset.
Experience with Generative AI technologies, prompt engineering, and large language models, is a strong asset.
Hands-on knowledge of vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Azure AI Search) for semantic search and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines is a strong asset.
Strong communication and business analysis skills and genuinely interested in understanding the customer‚Äôs business context and challenges.
You can explain complex technical concepts in simple, accessible language to non-technical stakeholders.
A collaborative, open-minded mindset and a drive to keep learning in a fast-evolving field.
You're fluent in Dutch or French, as well as English.


What we can offer:


A dynamic role within OptimAI, a leading AI competence center focused on applied, impactful AI.
The opportunity to work on real-world projects across sectors, from logistics and government to healthcare and finance.
Access to expert colleagues, mentorship, and tailored learning opportunities to accelerate your growth.
A flexible hybrid work model and a strong focus on work-life balance.
A culture of innovation, inclusion, and continuous improvement where your ideas and input are valued.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe‚Äôs Leading Digital Service Provider.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A company car or mobility budget
Laptop, phone & phone subscription
A competitive salary and indefinite contract
Insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development


People are the cornerstone of our success. That‚Äôs why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!‚ÄØ

At OptimAI, we combine the best of both worlds: data science and supply chain optimization. You will be part of a forward-thinking team where you can shape the future of data science and supply chain management. This is an excellent opportunity to make a real difference and grow your career in a field that is rapidly evolving and in high demand.

If you thrive on challenge, continuous learning, and want to make an impact in a fast-growing field, apply now to join the OptimAI Team.

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Python Engineer ‚Äì HFT ‚Äì fully remote - up to $150,000 Salary + Bonus
Description:
Your Python code could move millions in seconds.




Most Python roles are about building applications. This one is about building trading systems that make split-second decisions in global markets.




You‚Äôll be helping to power the next generation of trading infrastructure, designing and building scalable, high-performance microservices all within a fast-paced environment. The other aspects will be to work closely with the wider team, collaborating with traders and other engineers to turn ideas into reality.




There are lots of projects going on but your initial focus will be helping to expand the exchange connectivity by adding new markets, building Python-based microservices for trading operations and developing features for funding rate prediction.




You‚Äôre going to ideally be coming from a HFT background, with a minimum of 5 years of experience developing Python based microservices. The team is small and spread across Europe so you will need to be independent and be able to push projects through autonomously. Where a lot of HFT environments require you to be on-site almost every day, this one gives you flexibility of where you're based.




This a global high-frequency trading firm, specialising in crypto markets and leveraging cutting-edge technology to shape the future of trading on real-time. Starting salary is around $150k plus bonuses.




If you want your work to shape real-world trading decisions in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, get in touch.




No up to date CV required.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer Intern ( Fully Remote)




Position: AI Engineer / Automation Developer

Location: Morocco

Employment Type: Internship




About the Role

We are looking for an experienced AI Engineer to design, develop, and deploy a suite of intelligent agents that automate recruitment and business workflows. The first project involves integrating with Bullhorn‚Äôs REST API to perform tasks such as job parsing, candidate search, shortlist creation, and personalized communications. Additional agents in our roadmap will interact with other systems (CRM, email, calendars, document processing) to streamline operations across multiple departments.




Key Responsibilities

Design and Architecture: Work with stakeholders to understand workflow requirements and translate them into agent‚Äëbased solutions. Design modular, scalable architectures for automated agents.
API Integration: Implement secure integrations with external services (e.g. Bullhorn CRM) using REST APIs and OAuth 2.0. Handle token management, session renewal, and rate limiting.
Workflow Automation: Develop agents that can parse job descriptions, build Boolean search queries, retrieve candidate data, and create job submissions or other records via API calls.
NLP & Data Extraction: Use natural language processing techniques to extract key skills, locations, and language requirements from unstructured text (job descriptions, resumes).
Email and Notification Services: Integrate with email providers or messaging APIs to send personalized communications to candidates and team members. Implement templating and personalization logic.
AI & ML Integration (future projects): Build or integrate machine‚Äëlearning models to rank candidates, recommend matches, or summarize documents as needed by other agents.
Deployment & DevOps: Package agents for deployment on cloud platforms or serverless environments. Ensure appropriate logging, monitoring, and alerting are in place.
Security & Compliance: Adhere to data privacy regulations (e.g. GDPR), secure storage of secrets (client IDs, secrets, passwords), and best practices for API usage.
Documentation & Collaboration: Produce clear documentation of APIs, workflows, and agent behavior. Collaborate with non‚Äëtechnical stakeholders to refine requirements and demonstrate prototypes.




Required Skills & Experience

Programming Expertise: Strong proficiency in Python or JavaScript/Node.js; experience with asynchronous programming and HTTP client libraries (requests, axios, etc.).
API & OAuth: Hands‚Äëon experience integrating with REST APIs that use OAuth 2.0 for authentication and authorization. Comfortable handling tokens, refresh flows, and error states.
Automation & Scripting: Proven ability to build automation scripts or bots that interact with multiple services, parse data, and perform CRUD operations via APIs.
Natural Language Processing: Familiarity with NLP techniques for keyword extraction, entity recognition, or text classification using libraries like spaCy, NLTK, or Hugging Face.
Data Parsing & Search: Experience constructing complex search queries (e.g. Boolean searches) and processing large sets of results.
Cloud & DevOps: Understanding of deployment on AWS, Azure, or GCP (Lambda, Cloud Functions, or containerized services). Experience with CI/CD pipelines and monitoring tools.
Version Control & Collaboration: Proficiency with Git and collaborative workflows (pull requests, code reviews).
Problem Solving & Communication: Strong analytical skills, ability to break down complex tasks, and communicate technical concepts to non‚Äëtechnical stakeholders.




Preferred/Bonus Skills

Prior experience with recruitment technologies (Bullhorn, ATS/CRM systems) or HR domain knowledge.
Experience with Zapier or other low‚Äëcode automation platforms and understanding when to use custom code vs. off‚Äëthe‚Äëshelf integrations.
Familiarity with front‚Äëend technologies if agent outputs are surfaced in dashboards or internal tools.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
We are currently seeking an AI Engineer to support one of our clients. The role will focus on developing Generative AI Assistants and driving AI innovation initiatives.




Location: Anderlecht, Brussels (onsite - 2days/week)

Languages: English, French / Dutch Preferred

Employment Type: Freelance / Employee

Start: As soon as possible




Context of the mission/Objective(s) of the job:

The client has developed several innovative Generative AI assistants to streamline high-value tasks across the company. With solutions that bring trials closer to patients, or that transform our internal helpdesks, Generative AI brings new opportunities to generate value for patients and the company. Your initial project will involve collaborating with app developers and users to productize an existing prototype using Python FastAPI and our custom internal framework. Beyond this initial project we will be looking to leverage your experience to enrich our Generative AI capabilities.

Responsibilities:

Develop applications that leverage Gen AI technology to solve specific business problems
Act as a team player within the platform team and collaborate closely with the teams that built the prototypes
Work with the infra teams to deploy the app, ensuring its supportability and maintainability
Maintain well-documented code, complete with necessary unit and integration tests

Requirements:

Proficient in Python and FastAPI
Experience with Generative AI, including the use of OpenAI and/or Azure OpenAI APIs.
Familiarity with standard data analytics libraries such as pandas, matplotlib, Streamlit, langchain, etc.
Experience with Generative AI design patterns, such as RAG, Agentic AI, Context engineering, structured response and so on.
Expertise in development tools, including GIT, IDE (preferably VSCode), and CI/CD (preferably Azure DevOps-based).
Ability to work independently, breaking down complex tasks into manageable subtasks and executing them.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a proven track record of collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
A proactive and results-driven mindset, capable of resolving issues independently or seeking help and driving issues to resolution.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a focus on developing innovative solutions.

About


AppTweak
AppTweak is the trusted app store acquisition partner for mobile leaders worldwide; we provide innovative solutions that help apps and games optimize their app store presence and increase downloads. For 10+ years, companies including Uber, Adobe, and Zynga have trusted our unique metrics, actionable insights, and expertise to make informed decisions and achieve long-term success in the competitive mobil

e market.Driven by data science and a human-centered approach, AppTweak is recognized for its innovative features and rapid growth. We have been awarded ‚ÄúASO Tool of the Year‚Äù and ‚ÄúApp Data Platform of the Year‚Äù by the App Growth Awards, and have been four times recognized as one of the fastest-growing technology companies by Deloitte

Belgium.Today we are a team of +120 people based in 7 offices around the globe (Brussels, San Francisco, Bengaluru, Tokyo, Seoul, London, and Beijing) supporting more than +2,000 customers worldwide. We‚Äôre gearing up for fast growth and are looking for ambitious individuals to join


our team!

Title: Data Scientist (Part-Time | Remote EU | $80 ‚Äì $120/hr)
Description:
Data Science Expert

Type: Hourly contract

Location: Part-time Remote (Fully Remote)

Compensation: 80‚Äì120 per hour

About the Role

Contribute your data science expertise to impactful research collaborations with leading AI labs. You‚Äôll work on code validation, prompt refinement, algorithmic evaluation, and model benchmarking‚Äîhelping improve the performance and reliability of advanced AI systems.

Key Responsibilities

Review and refine AI-generated prompts, responses, and code
Validate technical concepts for accuracy and clarity
Provide structured feedback on solution quality
Tag and organize content by topic and difficulty
Support benchmarking efforts to assess model capabilities

Ideal Qualifications

3+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, or applied statistics (industry or research)
Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or related quantitative field (Bachelor‚Äôs required; advanced degree preferred)
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL (R, Java, or Scala a plus)
Experience with machine learning frameworks such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch
Skilled in statistical analysis, data wrangling, and feature engineering on large datasets

Project Timeline

Start Date: Immediate
Duration: 1‚Äì2 months
Commitment: 15‚Äì25 hours/week (flexible up to 40 hours)
Schedule: Fully remote, asynchronous, flexible hours

Compensation & Contract

80‚Äì120 per hour based on experience
Independent contractor engagement
Daily payments via Stripe Connect

Application Process

Upload your resume
Short AI interview (15 minutes) to discuss background and experience
Follow-up within a few days with next steps and onboarding details

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Remote - Europe or Asia)
Description:
Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.

One of our partner companies is currently looking for a Senior Data Scientist - B2B based in Europe or Asia.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will join a distributed team focused on unlocking insights that power data-driven decisions for B2B initiatives. You'll work closely with other data scientists and engineers to explore user behavior, design impactful experiments, and develop strategic models that improve customer acquisition, retention, and product development. Your work will directly shape how professionals use digital tools at scale in a rapidly growing market segment. The team values autonomy, documentation, and async-first collaboration, with flexibility for remote work and timezone balance.

Accountabilities:


Analyze user behavior to uncover drivers of activation, engagement, churn, and upgrades
Lead experimentation efforts, including A/B test design and impact attribution
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to surface strategic insights and greenfield opportunities
Develop self-serve analytics tools, dashboards, and data literacy programs
Build and maintain predictive models and use case clustering solutions
Perform ETL tasks and model new data dimensions for strategic decision-making
Attribute product and marketing impact to core KPIs with statistical rigor



Requirements


6+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related field
Strong proficiency in SQL, Python or R, and modern BI/analytics tools (e.g., dbt)
Expertise in statistical methods, experimentation design, and machine learning techniques
Proven experience analyzing large datasets to solve business problems
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain insights to non-technical audiences
Strong stakeholder management and ability to influence cross-functional teams
Passion for continuous learning, fast iteration, and working in a dynamic, async environment



Benefits


Meaningful equity in a profitable tech company
Flexible remote work with sponsored visits to regional offices (Hong Kong or London)
Annual company offsite (e.g., Portugal 2023, Bali 2024)
Comprehensive medical insurance for you and your dependents
Home office and wellness budget (equipment, training, etc.)
Flexible working hours and an async-first work culture



Jobgether hiring process disclaimer

This job is posted on behalf of one of our partner companies. If you choose to apply, your application will go through our AI-powered 3-step screening process, where we automatically select the 5 best candidates.

Our AI thoroughly analyzes every line of your CV and LinkedIn profile to assess your fit for the role, evaluating each experience in detail. When needed, our team may also conduct a manual review to ensure only the most relevant candidates are considered.

Our process is fair, unbiased, and based solely on qualifications and relevance to the job. Only the best-matching candidates will be selected for the next round.

If you are among the top 5 candidates, you will be notified within 7 days.

If you do not receive feedback after 7 days, it means you were not selected. However, if you wish, we may consider your profile for other similar opportunities that better match your experience.

Thank you for your interest!

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to shape the future of AI in clinical research? Join Clario as an AI Engineer, where your expertise in machine learning, generative AI, and software engineering will drive transformative solutions across the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries. You‚Äôll be at the forefront of innovation‚Äîdesigning intelligent systems, fine-tuning large language models, and building scalable AI services that directly impact patient outcomes worldwide.




What We Offer

Competitive compensation
Attractive benefits (security, flexibility, support, and well-being)
Remote or hybrid working options
Full technology setup and support




What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Design and develop AI-powered software solutions using GenAI and machine learning frameworks
Build and optimize data processing pipelines for model training and evaluation
Train and fine-tune AI models, including LLMs, for real-world applications
Implement testing strategies and performance benchmarks to ensure model reliability
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align AI initiatives with business goals
Stay current with emerging trends in GenAI, AI research, and software development
Engage with scientific literature and contribute to innovation across the organization
Support internal teams by resolving technical issues and sharing best practices
Foster a collaborative and inclusive team environment




What We‚Äôre Looking For

Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering, Physics, or related field (Bachelor‚Äôs with relevant experience also considered)
Minimum 3 years of experience in software development
Strong proficiency in Python and experience with ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch)
Experience training, validating, and deploying AI models; LLM fine-tuning is a plus
Familiarity with AWS and Agile development environments
Creative problem-solving mindset and ability to adapt to changing priorities
Excellent communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills
Attention to detail and commitment to quality




Why Clario?

At Clario, we put people first‚Äîalways. United by our mission to improve patient outcomes, we‚Äôre committed to transforming clinical trials through cutting-edge technology. We value every contribution and foster a culture of innovation, inclusion, and continuous learning.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer F/M/X
Description:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade ‚Äì this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We‚Äôre focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

Are you a skilled ML Engineer ready for your next adventure? Amaris Consulting is on the lookout for a motivated individual with a strong background in machine learning to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Brussels. This is a great opportunity for professionals with keen analytical abilities, a strong technical sense, and excellent communication skills.

üî• Your Responsibilities:



Design, build, and train machine learning models to address complex business problems.
Fine-tune model performance through feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and validation techniques.
Develop pipelines to deploy machine learning models into production, ensuring reliability and scalability.
Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders to align model outcomes with strategic goals.
Stay up to date with emerging ML techniques and tools, contributing to continuous improvement initiatives.



üéØ Your Profile:

We are seeking a candidate with a strong background in machine learning and excellent problem-solving skills. Your attention to detail and ability to simplify complex information will set you apart. You thrive in collaborative environments but can also work independently when needed.



Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).
Understanding of statistical methods, data processing, and model evaluation techniques.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
Experience with cloud-based ML platforms (AWS SageMaker, Google AI Platform, Azure ML).
Proven track record in deploying machine learning models at scale.



üöÄ Advantages:



An international learning environment.
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.



üí° We are an independent company that values:



Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.



Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Python AI Engineer
Description:
Senior Python Engineer - Fully remote - Europe




Our client is reimagining industry operations with AI-driven technology, enabling faster decision-making and intelligent insights. Their platform streamlines data access and automates evaluations, reducing review times from weeks to minutes.




The Role

Design, develop, and deploy backend systems and AI infrastructure. Work closely with the CTO and product team to build scalable solutions.




Key Responsibilities

Write modular, efficient Python code following best practices
Build and optimize RAG pipelines for processing large-scale unstructured data
Develop knowledge graph systems for advanced querying and reasoning
Participate in architectural discussions for scalable backend systems
Maintain high code quality through rigorous testing
Collaborate through code reviews and knowledge-sharing sessions
Stay current with emerging Python, NLP, and AI technologies




Requirements

Proven Python development experience, preferably in data-driven or AI environments
Experience with NLP techniques, Knowledge Graphs, and RAG preferred
Proficiency in Python frameworks (e.g., FastAPI)
Familiarity with cloud platforms
Strong testing capabilities (unit, integration tests)




What They Offer

Work with cutting-edge AI technologies and RAG solutions
Tackle complex problems with real-world impact
Collaborative, learning-focused team environment
Growth opportunities in a fast-growing company
Competitive salary plus equity options
Mission-driven work improving industry efficiency
