Title: Research Scientist (Machine Learning), Lausanne
Description:
Isomorphic Labs is applying frontier AI to help unlock deeper scientific insights, faster breakthroughs, and life-changing medicines with an ambition to solve all disease.

The future is coming. A future enabled and enriched by the incredible power of machine learning. A future in which diseases are curtailed or cured starting with better and faster drug discovery.

Come and be part of an interdisciplinary team driving groundbreaking innovation and play a meaningful role in contributing towards us achieving our ambitious goals, while being a part of an inspiring and collaborative culture.

The world we want tomorrow is the one we‚Äôre building today. It starts with the culture at this company. It starts with you.

About Iso

Isomorphic Labs (IsoLabs) was launched in 2021 to advance human health by building on and beyond the Nobel-winning AlphaFold system. Since then, our interdisciplinary team of drug discovery experts and machine learning specialists has built powerful new predictive and generative AI models that accelerate scientific discovery at digital speed.

Our name comes from the belief that there is an underlying symmetry between biology and information science. By harnessing AI‚Äôs powerful capabilities, we can use it to model complex biological phenomena to help design novel molecules, anticipate how drugs will perform and develop innovative medicines to treat and cure some of the world‚Äôs most devastating diseases.

We have built a world-leading drug design engine comprising AI models that are capable of working across multiple therapeutic areas and drug modalities. We are continually innovating on model architecture and developing cutting-edge capabilities to advance rational drug design.

Every day, and with each new breakthrough, we‚Äôre getting closer to the promise of digital biology, and achieving our ambitious mission to one day solve all disease with the help of AI.

Research Scientist (Machine Learning), Lausanne

Your impact

As a Research Scientist in machine learning (ML), you will play an exciting role in building greenfield machine learning based models and algorithms that will power our platform to transform the drug discovery world as we know it.

Working in a highly creative, fast-paced and interdisciplinary environment, you will be partnering with leading engineers and scientists to conceive, design, and develop cutting edge machine learning algorithms to unlock new modelling and predictive power which will be critical to the organisation‚Äôs success. You will draw upon your existing deep research experience whilst learning from those around you, to apply novel techniques and ideas to newly encountered computational biology and chemistry problems.

Depending on your experience:

You will create and lead projects, bringing together a variety of disciplined scientists and engineers to pursue some of the most ambitious modelling problems with deep learning - as well as providing technical mentorship and people management for others in the ML community at Isomorphic Labs

You will be instrumental in leading greenfield machine learning based research projects, building the models, and algorithms that will power our platform to transform the drug discovery world as we know it.

What You Will Do


Contribute to our research directions in machine learning by using your extensive knowledge of the field to apply world-leading ML algorithms to drug discovery.
Identify and create novel ML techniques and the required data to train.
Develop the architectures and training algorithms of machine learning models.
Analyse and tune experimental results to inform future experimental directions.
Implement and scale training and inference engineering frameworks.
Report and present research findings and developments clearly and efficiently, to both other ML scientists and scientists of different disciplines.
Iterate collaboratively with scientists and domain experts, sharing your own domain experience.
Suggest and engage in team collaborations to meet ambitious research goals.


Depending on your experience:


Provide technical mentorship and guidance to the ML research community, advising on projects, and shaping our research roadmap based on your deep technical expertise.
Provide developmental support to other ML research scientists.
Create, lead, and run ML research projects, fostering collaborative and diverse teams to solve high priority modelling problems.Cultivate a diverse and inclusive research culture.


Essential

Skills and qualifications


PhD or equivalent practical experience in a technical field.
A proven track record in machine learning using deep learning techniques, including designing new architectures, hands-on experimentation, analysis, and visualisation.
Strong knowledge of linear algebra, calculus and statistics.
Experience using ML frameworks such as JAX, PyTorch, or TensorFlow, and scientific software such as NumPy, SciPy, or Pandas.
A passion for applying ML research to real world problems.
Depending on your experience: project supervision, leadership, or management.


Nice to have


PhD in machine learning or computer science.
Relevant research experience to the position such as post doctoral roles, a proven track record of publications, or contributions to machine learning codebases.
Experience working in a scientific environment across disciplines (particularly biology, chemistry, physics).
Experience working with biological or chemical data and biological or chemistry software.
Experience working with real-world datasets.
Experience with ML on accelerators.
Experience in any of: large scale deep learning, generative models, graph neural networks, deep learning for drug discovery, deep learning for computer vision, 3D graphics/robotics, real-world applied RL.


Culture and values

We are guided by our shared values. It's not about finding people who think and act in the same way. These values help to guide our work and will continue to strengthen it.

Thoughtful

Thoughtful at Iso is about curiosity, creativity and care. It is about good people doing good, rigorous and future-making science every single day.

Brave

Brave at Iso is about fearlessness, but it‚Äôs also about initiative and integrity. The scale of the challenge demands nothing less.

Determined

Determined at Iso is the way we pursue our goal. It‚Äôs a confidence in our hypothesis, as well as the urgency and agility needed to deliver on it. Because disease won‚Äôt wait, so neither should we.

Together

Together at Iso is about connection, collaboration across fields and catalytic relationships. It‚Äôs knowing that transformation is a group project, and remembering that what we‚Äôre doing will have a real impact on real people everywhere.

Creating An Extraordinary Company

We believe that to be successful we need a team with a range of skills and talents. We're building an environment where collaboration is fundamental, learning is shared and every employee feels supported and able to thrive. We value unique experiences, knowledge, backgrounds, and perspectives, and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact.

We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Hybrid working

It‚Äôs hugely important for us to share knowledge and build strong relationships with each other, and we find it easier to do this if we spend time together in person. This is why we follow a hybrid model, and would require you to be able to come into the office 3 days a week (currently Tuesday, Wednesday, and one other day depending on which team you‚Äôre in). If you have additional needs that would prevent you from following this hybrid approach, we‚Äôd be happy to talk through these if you‚Äôre selected for an initial screening call.

Please note that when you submit an application, your data will be processed in line with our privacy policy.

Title: Python Developer (Data Science) - Energy - Geneva
Description:
Our client is a major global commodity trader with annual revenues in excess of $200bn.




As a Software Engineer in the Data Science team you will assist the Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers and also the business (Traders, Risk, Operations). You will act as the 'bridge' between data science > technology > business.




Responsibilities:




‚Ä¢ Deliver models and solutions to business users, and other technology teams

‚Ä¢ Develop, test, maintain software tools / data pipelines for machine learning

‚Ä¢ Provide software engineering and design expertise and best practices (Python)

‚Ä¢ Take ownership of key technical infrastructure

‚Ä¢ Engage with projects at any point in their lifecycle, from bug fixing to reliability

‚Ä¢ Actively participating in and leading code reviews, experiment design and tooling decisions

Qualifications:




‚Ä¢ 3-5+ years in industry; fluency in Python with ability to design and write clean, modular, well-documented code and a solid understanding of coding best practices

‚Ä¢ Master‚Äôs degree in computer science or a related field

‚Ä¢ Ability and desire to learn and apply new technologies

‚Ä¢ Ability to logically evolve an architecture from prototype to product

‚Ä¢ Collaborative approach to problem solving - ability to effectively pair program

‚Ä¢ Effective technical communicator - both written and verbal

‚Ä¢ Experience with data engineering, APIs, and cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP) and containerization technologies (Docker)

‚Ä¢ Experience with enterprise software development lifecycle (including CI / CD)

‚Ä¢ Experience with machine learning workflows, cloud scale machine learning infrastructure (including LLMs), big data (e.g. Spark)

‚Ä¢ Experience in the energy, commodities or financial trading industries, with knowledge of financial markets and trading concepts

HTML:
Our client is a major global commodity trader with annual revenues in excess of $200bn.


As a Software Engineer in the Data Science team you will assist the Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers and also the business (Traders, Risk, Operations). You will act as the 'bridge' between data science > technology > business.


Responsibilities:


‚Ä¢ Deliver models and solutions to business users, and other technology teams

‚Ä¢ Develop, test, maintain software tools / data pipelines for machine learning

‚Ä¢ Provide software engineering and design expertise and best practices (Python)

‚Ä¢ Take ownership of key technical infrastructure

‚Ä¢ Engage with projects at any point in their lifecycle, from bug fixing to reliability

‚Ä¢ Actively participating in and leading code reviews, experiment design and tooling decisions

Qualifications:


‚Ä¢ 3-5+ years in industry; fluency in Python with ability to design and write clean, modular, well-documented code and a solid understanding of coding best practices

‚Ä¢ Master‚Äôs degree in computer science or a related field

‚Ä¢ Ability and desire to learn and apply new technologies

‚Ä¢ Ability to logically evolve an architecture from prototype to product

‚Ä¢ Collaborative approach to problem solving - ability to effectively pair program

‚Ä¢ Effective technical communicator - both written and verbal

‚Ä¢ Experience with data engineering, APIs, and cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP) and containerization technologies (Docker)

‚Ä¢ Experience with enterprise software development lifecycle (including CI / CD)

‚Ä¢ Experience with machine learning workflows, cloud scale machine learning infrastructure (including LLMs), big data (e.g. Spark)

‚Ä¢ Experience in the energy, commodities or financial trading industries, with knowledge of financial markets and trading concepts

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (OSS) in a fast-growing AI Startup
Description:
At the ETH spin-off Lightly, we build software solutions to help companies improve their deep learning models. The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.




We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.




Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




We use a modern stack of:





PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS


Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS



Tasks


As a Machine Learning Engineer in the core ML team, you will be part of a team which works mainly on our open-source package for self-supervised learning and similar internal frameworks.




Particularly, you will get to:





Work on our open-source Python package for self-supervised learning: https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Add support for finetuning pretrained models for downstream tasks including many different computer vision tasks like object detection, segmentation, tracking, and more.


Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.


All these tasks will include working with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision language models and deep learning for computer vision in general.


Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.


Represent the company at machine learning conferences and engage with the community.





In general, for this role expect to use the stack we use for our open-source package https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Requirements


Ideally, you have:





MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field


Experience in deep learning and computer vision, ideally in self-supervised learning and you have worked with PyTorch.


Excellent Python coding skills and knowledge of software engineering best practices. Experience with testing and typed Python is a big plus.


Experience with building and shipping software solutions.


Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.



Benefits


We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




Interested? Contact us!




We look forward to getting to know you!

Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer

Type: Permanent contract

Location: Switzerland (Lausanne or Zurich)

About Us

At Visium, we enable enterprise executives in defining their AI & Data strategy, executing large scale transformations and implementing AI across operations, ensuring their organization becomes future-proof.

With expertise in strategy, architecture, cloud engineering, analytics, artificial intelligence and machine learning, we empower our clients to unleash and scale the power of their data.

We're on a mission to pioneer a bright future and build future-proof and ethical organizations. Join the curious, the ambitious, the doers, the good-hearted, the ones who build a world we're all in awe of - our Visumees.

Ready to become one?

Role

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will assume a technical leadership role in designing, implementing and deploying innovative solutions with tangible business impact. Join our growing team and contribute to our expansion in Switzerland and internationally

Coupling state-of-the-art Machine Learning techniques with best practices in Software Engineering you will build robust and scalable applications that empower our clients to drive meaningful value from their data. You are passionate about understanding client needs to drive top-notch customer experience and adoption. Finally, you are meticulously organized and prepared to work in a fast-paced and dynamic team environment.

Requirements

Embark on a rewarding journey where you


Proactively take ownership of projects, making decisions and ensuring successful outcomes
Embrace challenges as opportunities to learn, actively seeking and sharing feedback to expand your skills
Exhibit genuine empathy, understanding diverse perspectives and fostering a collaborative and team-oriented atmosphere
Have strong communication skills and the ability to present insights to non-technical and technical stakeholders in an accessible way


In addition, this should be part of your background to apply


4+ years of professional experience as a Machine Learning or Data Scientist or in a relevant role
Experience with ML/DL frameworks and tools in Python (e.g., Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, huggingface/transformers)
Proficiency in Software Development best practices (e.g., Object-Oriented Programming, Design Patterns, Agile Methodology)
Experience in applying deep learning approaches, such as recurrent and convolutional neural networks and transformer models
Experience with MLOps best practices and tools (e.g., dvc, MLFlow, tfX, Kubeflow)
Experience developing and deploying ML solutions using Cloud services (e.g., AWS Sagemaker, GCP Vertex.AI, Azure ML)
Familiarity with REST API and microservices
Fluent in English and in French and/or German. Other languages are a plus.


The following are a plus


Experience with Data and AI platforms (Databricks, Dataiku, Snowflake) or an associated Data Engineer certification
Experience working in a client-facing or consulting role
Familiarity with Generative AI models & tools (e.g., langchain, OpenAI API, LLama2)
Familiarity with web development (e.g., Next.js, React, FastAPI, Flask)


Benefits

What we offer


A competitive compensation package
A yearly education budget to steep your learning curve
A yearly sport budget because a fit body leads to a fit mind
A flexible working culture because your work-life balance matters to us
A position that enables you to have an impact on 1'000s of people, and the whole company's growth
An international, knowledgeable, and passionate team with a strong collaborative mindset


Check our LinkedIn and website to learn more about us & don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
THIS JOB IS NOT A REMOTE JOB. WORK ONSITE IS OBLIGATORY.




Snapbau is a digital purchasing management platform used by more than 320 construction companies in Switzerland, including major players such as Orllati, CPSA, Scrasa and ARSA. Our solution automates and optimises the management of calls for tender and purchasing, enabling companies to save time, reduce errors and centralise collaboration with suppliers.




You will be part of the team responsible for designing and building the AI layer of Snapbau‚Äôs digital operating system for procurement and coordination in the construction sector.


Tasks


AI System Design & Development





Develop machine learning and AI models to automate and optimize construction procurement workflows (e.g. price prediction, document classification, lead scoring, supplier matching).


Build generative AI features to assist with document generation, meeting summaries, and structured communication.


Create and maintain pipelines for training, testing, and deploying ML models.


Develop lightweight APIs or services to integrate AI modules into the Snapbau platform.





Data Engineering & Management





Work closely with backend developers to structure, clean, and extract usable data from various sources (e.g. supplier databases, project histories, tender documents).


Apply construction-specific taxonomies (e.g. eBKP-H, CRB) to enable structured, domain-relevant decision-making.


Improve model performance through effective feature engineering based on our domain data.





Product Integration





Collaborate with product managers and frontend developers to design and implement AI-powered tools for end users.


Ensure AI components are integrated into Snapbau‚Äôs user experience in a fast, reliable, and intuitive way.


Monitor model performance post-deployment and adjust based on feedback and new data.





Strategy & Innovation





Contribute to Snapbau‚Äôs long-term AI architecture and roadmap.


Stay updated on advancements in applied AI (LLMs, computer vision, agent workflows, etc.) and evaluate their relevance for construction tech.


Help define AI-related hiring, tooling, and infrastructure needs as the team scales.



Requirements



Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning models (especially NLP, classification, recommendation, or price prediction).


Strong programming skills in Python; familiarity with frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn, FastAPI.


Experience building and maintaining ML pipelines.


Familiarity with REST APIs and integrating ML models into production environments.


Solid understanding of data wrangling and structuring from messy or unstructured sources.


Knowledge of or willingness to learn domain-specific standards such as eBKP-H or CRB is a strong plus.


Experience working in fast-paced, cross-functional product teams.


Ability to work autonomously while contributing to a strategic, long-term vision.





Join Snapbau if you want to shape how AI transforms the future of construction procurement. This role offers high impact, deep technical ownership, and a direct path into one of the most overlooked but critical sectors of the real economy.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About Laine




Laine Neural Network SA is a LegalTech company developing an international terminal that automates legal drafting through generative AI and machine learning, aimed at connecting end-users with licensed lawyers.




Role Description

The Senior Machine Learning Engineer will be responsible for developing and optimizing machine learning models, implementing neural networks, and conducting pattern recognition and statistical analysis. The role involves collaborating with cross-functional teams to enhance AI-driven solutions and contribute to the continuous improvement of the platform.




Qualifications




Experience in Pattern Recognition and Neural Networks
Strong background in deep learning (PyTorch, TensorFlow) and modern ML workflows
Proven experience with AI agents (e.g., LangChain, Auto-GPT, OpenAI APIs, ReAct, or similar frameworks)
Strong background in Computer Science and Algorithms
Proven experience with AI agents (e.g., LangChain, Auto-GPT, OpenAI APIs, ReAct, or similar frameworks)
Proficiency in Statistics and applied statistical analysis
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work collaboratively
Advanced degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field
Experience in the legal tech industry is a plus
Strong communication skills in English
Based in Switzerland or authorized to work there




Successful candidates must be willing to learn further and develop their Machine Learning skills. They must also work with a team based in Geneva, Switzerland, Ghent, Belgium, and Dubai, UAE. They must be proactive and have a ‚Äòcan-do‚Äô attitude. We are looking for good team players. If you have an interest in the intersection of law, technology, and AI and meet the criteria above, we invite you to apply.







Send your applications to recruitment@laine.ai.

Title: NLP Engineers/Scientist
Description:
NLP Engineer / Scientist




Essentials (please *don't apply* if you don't match all three):

You should have EU or Swiss nationality/C permit.
You should be top 5% both at your Bachelor and at your Master.
You should upload your full transcripts (Essentials (please *don't apply* if you don't match all three):




Role

Identify and design innovative solutions using neural networks and other natural language processing algorithms.
Experiment, evaluate, and customize state-of-the-art techniques.
Implement and roll out production-grade natural language processing solutions.
Manage or co-manage client projects.

¬†

Required competence and attitudes

Bachelor+Master's (top 5%) in AI/ML, Computer Science or Engineering.
Fluency in Python and strong programming capabilities.
Experience with deep learning frameworks (PyTorch/TensorFlow) and NumPy.
Knowledge of common NLP concepts, from TFIDF-based approaches to Transformer-based ones.
Knowledge of common NLP tasks, e.g. NER, POS, sentiment analysis, machine translation, ....
Attitude and willingness to continuously learn and improve skills and knowledge.
Capability to interact with clients, data scientists, ML engineers, and DevOps experts.

¬†

A PhD.
Fluency in C++.
Familiarity with Hugging Face ecosystem, deep learning libraries (e.g. ONNX), or NLP libraries (e.g. spaCy).
Experience with neural networks in computer vision.
Knowledge of reinforcement learning techniques.
Previous related work experience.




We offer

Full-time permanent contract.
Fast career development, attractive compensation.
Stimulating scientific context and informal environment.
Training, tutoring, and close relationship with leading-edge research and technology.

Title: Computational Scientist Intern
Description:
About Corintis:

Corintis offers innovative microfluidic cooling technologies for data centers. Our solutions improve compute sustainability and tackle the excessive electricity consumption associated with data center cooling, which consumes more electricity than New York and London combined. By integrating cooling directly inside the chip, we pave the way for the next generation of AI workloads, supporting applications like generative AI systems, climate modeling, and drug discovery to enable the future of sustainable computing.

Working at Corintis:

Corintis offers a friendly and team-oriented workplace bringing together a diverse group of nationalities to solve the biggest computing challenges of tomorrow. Based on the EPFL campus near Lausanne, we are closely connected to the local ecosystem and are located a few minutes walk from Lake Geneva.

Job Description:

Seeking a motivated developer with expertise in numerical methods, who can work independently and demonstrates resourcefulness. Proactive candidates with prior experience in reading scientific computing literature are preferred. Responsibilities include implementing various algorithms in our Computational Fluid Dynamics software, encompassing new turbulence models and remeshing techniques.

Responsibilities:


Develop and optimize code for our Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) software using programming languages such as C and Python.
Contribute to the development of an adaptive mesh refinement strategy for our simulations.
Work collaboratively with our team of engineers and scientists to troubleshoot technical issues in our software.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of new advances in CFD methods.
Provide support to the team in the form of code reviews and technical guidance.
Develop technical documentation for new and existing features.
Present complex research findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.


Requirements:


Strong academic background in numerical mathematics, computational engineering, computational physics or equivalent education.
Experience with programming languages such as C and Python.
Comfortable with standard software development practices: version control, continuous integration, code review, etc.
Familiarity with numerical methods and their implementation.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Fluent in English
Experience with open source finite element software such as FEniCS, firedrake, deal.ii, mfem, ngsolve or gridap.
Experience collaborating on open source projects.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Capable of organizing own work with minimal supervision.


What we offer:


Start date: Immediately
Contract: Paid Internship 6 months
Activity rate: 100%
Salary: 2,500 CHF gross per month
Location: On-site in Lausanne

Title: Data Scientist in Image Analysis
Description:
To reinforce our team in Bern, we are seeking a

Data Scientist in Image Analysis

Job tasks

The Department for Biomedical Research (DBMR) is launching a new Biological Data Science Hub and invites applications for a Data Scientist specialized in image analysis. This is a unique opportunity to take on a leadership role in shaping the future of data-driven biomedical research at the University of Bern and beyond.

About The Hub

The Biological Data Science Hub has three key missions:


Education: Empowering labs to adopt cutting-edge data science methods by training PhDs and postdocs and embedding best practices directly in research groups.
Community: Building a strong data science culture through regular meetings, collaborations with national and international partners, and yearly symposia.
Open Data: Promoting FAIR data practices, sharing code, and fostering reproducible, cost-efficient research.


As a pillar leader in image analysis, you will play a central role in advancing these missions.

Your Role

Role

We are seeking a scientist with expertise in biological image analysis who can combine technical excellence with vision and initiative. In this role, you will:


Lead the image analysis pillar of the Hub, bringing independence and initiative.
Design and implement state-of-the-art pipelines for biological imaging data.
Curate, collect, and manage datasets, contributing to the creation of a university-wide repository.
Guide and mentor researchers across DBMR labs in best practices and advanced image-analysis methods.
Organize training sessions, workshops, and community events.
Represent the Hub nationally and internationally by promoting our activities at conferences and building collaborations.
Contribute to setting standards for FAIR and reproducible data science.


Profile requirements

Your Profile


PhD or MSc in computer science, biomedical image analysis, or a related field.
Expertise in image data science, including machine learning and deep learning.
Strong programming skills (Python required; R or similar desirable).
Experience in HPC/Linux environmentsand data-parallel processing.
Ability to work independently, take initiative, and lead projects.
Excellent communication and mentoring skills, with a collaborative mindset.


Desirable


Experience with microscopy image analysis (high-content screening, EM, light-sheet, confocal, etc.).
Familiarity with tools such as Fiji, CellProfiler, Napari.
Experience in collaborative software development.
Background in research or clinical data environments.


We Offer


A 3-year fully funded position (80‚Äì100%).
A leadership role in a newly established, high-impact initiative.
Opportunities for career development and visibility within Switzerland‚Äôs leading biomedical and data science networks (EPFL AI Center, SIB, NCCR RNA & Disease, Zurich Vision Center).
A dynamic, international, and interdisciplinary environment within the Faculty of Medicine.
A supportive, collaborative team of experts in AI, data analysis, and computational biology.
Competitive salary and benefits.


Practical Information


Start date: As soon as possible
Contract type 1-year renewable (up to 3 years)
Activity rate: 80‚Äì100%


How to apply

If you are interested in this challenging and highly interesting position, please send your application including CV, letter of motivation and names and contact details of 1-3 referees to raphaelle.luisier@unibe.ch.

HTML:
To reinforce our team in Bern, we are seeking a

Data Scientist in Image Analysis

Job tasks

The Department for Biomedical Research (DBMR) is launching a new Biological Data Science Hub and invites applications for a Data Scientist specialized in image analysis. This is a unique opportunity to take on a leadership role in shaping the future of data-driven biomedical research at the University of Bern and beyond.

About The Hub

The Biological Data Science Hub has three key missions:

  • Education: Empowering labs to adopt cutting-edge data science methods by training PhDs and postdocs and embedding best practices directly in research groups.
  • Community: Building a strong data science culture through regular meetings, collaborations with national and international partners, and yearly symposia.
  • Open Data: Promoting FAIR data practices, sharing code, and fostering reproducible, cost-efficient research.

As a pillar leader in image analysis, you will play a central role in advancing these missions.

Your Role

Role

We are seeking a scientist with expertise in biological image analysis who can combine technical excellence with vision and initiative. In this role, you will:

  • Lead the image analysis pillar of the Hub, bringing independence and initiative.
  • Design and implement state-of-the-art pipelines for biological imaging data.
  • Curate, collect, and manage datasets, contributing to the creation of a university-wide repository.
  • Guide and mentor researchers across DBMR labs in best practices and advanced image-analysis methods.
  • Organize training sessions, workshops, and community events.
  • Represent the Hub nationally and internationally by promoting our activities at conferences and building collaborations.
  • Contribute to setting standards for FAIR and reproducible data science.

Profile requirements

Your Profile

  • PhD or MSc in computer science, biomedical image analysis, or a related field.
  • Expertise in image data science, including machine learning and deep learning.
  • Strong programming skills (Python required; R or similar desirable).
  • Experience in HPC/Linux environmentsand data-parallel processing.
  • Ability to work independently, take initiative, and lead projects.
  • Excellent communication and mentoring skills, with a collaborative mindset.

Desirable

  • Experience with microscopy image analysis (high-content screening, EM, light-sheet, confocal, etc.).
  • Familiarity with tools such as Fiji, CellProfiler, Napari.
  • Experience in collaborative software development.
  • Background in research or clinical data environments.

We Offer

  • A 3-year fully funded position (80‚Äì100%).
  • A leadership role in a newly established, high-impact initiative.
  • Opportunities for career development and visibility within Switzerland‚Äôs leading biomedical and data science networks (EPFL AI Center, SIB, NCCR RNA & Disease, Zurich Vision Center).
  • A dynamic, international, and interdisciplinary environment within the Faculty of Medicine.
  • A supportive, collaborative team of experts in AI, data analysis, and computational biology.
  • Competitive salary and benefits.

Practical Information

  • Start date: As soon as possible
  • Contract type 1-year renewable (up to 3 years)
  • Activity rate: 80‚Äì100%

How to apply

If you are interested in this challenging and highly interesting position, please send your application including CV, letter of motivation and names and contact details of 1-3 referees to raphaelle.luisier@unibe.ch.

Title: AI & Software Internship
Description:
At Neurosoft Bioelectronics, we are building implantable brain-computer interfaces (iBCIs) aimed at addressing severe neurological conditions, leveraging novel materials designed to enhance long-term functionality within the human body. Despite advancements in our understanding of neuronal activity, decoding brain signals in a clear and reliable way remains a complex challenge.




We have gathered specific datasets of brain activity recorded from animal models, and more recently, from human subjects using our iBCIs. To advance our research, we are investigating how advanced artificial intelligence (AI) techniques, including foundation models across various modalities, can be used to improve decoding of these neuronal signals.




We are looking to test various strategies using AI foundation models to decode brain activity. This project will span over a minimum of 6 months and will involve the following steps:





Data and meta-data curation, preparation, and formatting to match models‚Äô inputs ‚Äî this will be done in-house at Neurosoft Bioelectronics based at Campus Biotech, in Geneva, Switzerland (months 1‚Äì2)


Development and tuning of a large-scale neuronal decoding model that can effectively combine brain datasets from different sources ‚Äî in collaboration with an external partner institution (months 2‚Äì6)


Model testing, fine-tuning, and decoding of brain data (months 5‚Äì6)



Tasks


We are looking for a motivated individual currently enrolled in a MSc study program at EPFL (or at an equivalent institution) willing to carry out a full-time 6-month unpaid internship at Neurosoft Bioelectronics. The project could then be extended depending on available funding.


Requirements


Education and experience: Ongoing MSc studies (preferably prior to MSc thesis) in one of the Neuro-X laboratories or within another closely related EPFL laboratory.




Specific skills:





Strong experience with AI models (e.g., adaptive transformers) and/or currently attending specific advanced machine learning courses


Background in basic human neuroscience and/or willingness to learn about auditory neuroscience


Ease & experience with code or data handling tools (e.g., python, MATLAB, ‚Ä¶)


Ease & experience with machine learning and deep learning models and tools (e.g., transformer architecture, deep learning models, CNNs, ‚Ä¶)


Willingness to collaborate with students and supervisors from partner institution outside of EPFL


Good communication skills and language level (at least C1) in English, French is a plus


Willingness to contribute to a fast-paced start-up environment



Benefits


The full-time 6-month internship will start in mid-September 2025, according to the semester's calendar.




Please include the following elements in your application compiled as a single PDF file:





Curriculum vitae (with academic transcripts/grades and attended courses)


A short motivation statement (max. one page), incl. a description of your career goals


The phone and/or email contact of at least two references.





Ready to contribute to groundbreaking medical device projects? If you believe you have the skills and enthusiasm we‚Äôre looking for, please apply. Qualified candidates will be contacted to arrange an introductory online interview. Join us on our journey to advance neurotechnology!

Show more

Title: AI Engineer (Swiss Startup)
Description:
AI Engineer / Software Engineer (60% - 100%)




Are you a passionate AI Software Engineer eager to grow your career in an innovative AI startup? Join us in the Greater Zurich Area - one of Europe‚Äôs emerging AI hubs.




Our mission is to make corporates succeed with AI by creating the next-level AI platform to accelerate teams with advanced AI agents. We are a dynamic team dedicated to making the latest AI technologies accessible to businesses and creating advanced AI solutions.




As an AI / Software Engineer, you will be an integral part of our creative team, contributing to the development of next-generation AI solutions. You will have the chance to enhance your software development skills and gain valuable experience in the fast-paced startup environment.




Our Offer:




Cutting-Edge AI Technologies: Work with the latest in AI and LLM language generation technologies.
Project Involvement: Participate in projects for renowned companies, from conception to deployment.
Professional Growth: Continuous learning opportunities and exchanges with leading AI experts.
Network Expansion: Grow your professional network within the AI and tech community.
Collaboration: Work closely with the founders and seasoned engineers.
Work-Life Balance: Flexible working hours and the option to work fully remotely.
Career Development: Clear paths for career progression within the company.




Your Responsibilities:




Software Development: Contribute to the development and optimization of our software products using Python and Azure OpenAI.
Frontend: Assist in the development of the NextJS frontend if you have an interest in full-stack engineering.
Feature Development: Conceptualize and implement new functionalities.
AI Training Support: Aid in the training and deployment of AI & ML models.




Your Profile:




Bachelor's degree: In Computer Science or AI, Information Technology, or experience in a related field.
Technical Skills: Strong proficiency in Python; familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts is a plus.
Passion for AI: A deep interest in AI technologies and eagerness to contribute to innovative projects.
Quick Learner: Ability to quickly adapt and contribute to ongoing projects.
Team Player: Collaborative mindset with a strong drive to achieve common goals.




About Voicetechhub:




AI Startup: Based in Zurich, offering a comprehensive AI Suite for SMEs and enterprises.
Educational Mission: Dedicated to educating society about AI.
Established in 2019: Committed to diversity in IT and AI.
Experienced Team: Serial, award-winning Founders with global scale experience. Over 10 years of expertise in Entrepreneurship, Conversational AI, Chatbots, Voice, and AI. Working with Fortune500 companies.
Global Reach: Operating internationally, with strong partnerships with ETH, ZHAW, HWZ, and big tech companies like NVIDIA or Microsoft and other AI tech startups.




Are you interested in joining this journey? Just give us a call or write on WhatsApp for an initial exchange! We look forward to meeting you.




Contact our CTO: andreas.meier@voicetechhub.com

Our Academy: www.voicetechhub.com
Our AI Agents Platform: www.ai-suite.ai

Title: Deep Learning Engineer, LLM Accuracy Evaluation
Description:
We are seeking senior engineers to pioneer new methodologies for accurately assessing the performance of ground-breaking deep learning models, including LLMs, RAG, agents, and vision models. You will collaborate across the organization to bring the latest Ô¨Çagship models from our community and partners‚Äîsuch as Gemma and Llama-3‚Äîto life as optimized NVIDIA Inference Microservices (NIM). This role offers an outstanding opportunity to craft the future of AI at a fast-growing company at the forefront of the AI revolution. Join our team of world-class software engineers and partners to deliver the most advanced models with lightning-fast inference. You'll work on the most powerful, enterprise-grade GPU clusters capable of hundreds of PetaFLOPS and gain early access to unreleased hardware, making a direct impact on NVIDIA's roadmap and the broader AI landscape!

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Collaborate closely with our partners and the open-source community to deliver their Ô¨Çagship models as highly optimized NVIDIA Inference Microservices (NIM).
Research and develop innovative deep learning methodologies to accurately evaluate new model families across diverse domains.
Analyze, inÔ¨Çuence, and enhance AI/DL libraries, frameworks, and APIs, ensuring consistency with the best engineering practices.
Research, prototype, and build robust tools and infrastructure pipelines to support our ground-breaking AI initiatives.


What We Need To See


BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science, AI, Applied Math, or a related Ô¨Åeld, or equivalent experience.
10+ years of hands-on experience in AI for natural language processing (NLP) and large language models (LLMs).
Strong problem-solving, debugging, performance analysis, test design, and documentation skills.
Solid mathematical foundations and expertise in AI/DL algorithms.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.


Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd


Experience in accuracy evaluation of LLMs (OpenLLM Leaderboard or HELM).
Hands-on experience with inference and deployment environments like TensorRT, ONNX, or Triton.
Passion for DevOps/MLOps practices in deep learning product development.
Experience running large-scale workloads in high-performance computing (HPC) clusters.
Strong understanding of Linux environments and containerization technologies like Docker.


NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Scientist- Client Facing- 80-100%
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Forward Deployed Data Scientist (FSI Enterprise Solutions) who is passionate about working directly with clients to develop AI Agents using Unique AI‚Äôs SDK. In this role, you will spend 3-4 days a week on-site with clients, enabling them to maximize the value of our platform while providing hands-on support and expertise. You will act as the primary technical point of contact for clients, ensuring smooth integration and adoption of Unique‚Äôs GenAI solutions while helping them build AI Agents using our SDK. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with internal product and engineering teams to tailor solutions to client-specific requirements.

Job Requirements

What you need to succeed


Hands-on experience with LLMs, including tool calling and low-level experimentation beyond frameworks, as well as prompt engineering for customer use cases
Proven experience developing and deploying GenAI solutions in production environments; hands-on experience with AI Agents is a plus
History of successfully delivering projects for clients, translating customer requirements into tailored solutions
Exceptional communication and documentation skills
4+ years of experience as a data scientist; expertise in financial and insurance environment is a plus
Master‚Äôs or Ph.D. degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field


Job Benefits

What we offer


You will join our internal AI Academy, where you‚Äôll rapidly level up your skills in working with cutting-edge LLM tooling. We are building state-of-the-art agents and reliable AI-driven workflows ‚Äî and we‚Äôll train you to do the same. By the end of the Academy, you‚Äôll be fully equipped to design, build, and deploy robust AI solutions directly with clients
Innovative Work Environment üöÄ Engage in groundbreaking projects within the Generative AI space
Leading Company üí™ A chance to be part of a leading company in a rapidly evolving industry
Culture üåø A modern company with flat hierarchies that focuses on a people-oriented culture and places great emphasis on transparency and open communication
Competitive compensation and investment opportunities üí∞

By the end of the Academy, you‚Äôll be fully equipped to design, build, and deploy robust AI solutions directly with clients
  • Innovative Work Environment üöÄ Engage in groundbreaking projects within the Generative AI space
  • Leading Company üí™ A chance to be part of a leading company in a rapidly evolving industry
  • Culture üåø A modern company with flat hierarchies that focuses on a people-oriented culture and places great emphasis on transparency and open communication
  • Competitive compensation and investment opportunities üí∞

Title: AI and Optimization Engineer
Description:
Contexte et environnement

TotalEnergies Gas and Power is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies (mainly gas, LNG and power). As such it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution.

Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply & demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc). In such context Trading helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

The team is within the Modelling and Analysis for Trading Strategy (MATS) department, which is responsible for the end-to-end design and development of comprehensive quantitative models, state-of-the-art analytical and AI tools, and research that help optimize trading decisions across all TGP trading desks. Positioned at the strategic interface between Trading, Risk Management and IT, it guarantees the agility, robustness and continuous innovation of the algorithms driving TGP market strategy.

We are looking for our new AI and Optimization Engineer. This position is based in Geneva and reports to the Manager AI & Quant Development (N+1) and the VP MATS (N+2). The role is part of the Gas Trading Division within the Gas Renewables & Power branch.

Activit√©s


You will be at the forefront of development of scalable, reusable, and intelligent frameworks that drive long-term P&L growth, ensuring they are built as maintainable, long-living, production-grade solutions.
You will build extensible frameworks that evolve with business needs and are used across different trading desks.
You will iteratively enhance these frameworks to support rapid feature delivery while minimizing technical debt and ensuring long-term maintainability.
You will develop and maintain production-grade Auto‚ÄëML libraries for time series forecasting, enabling rapid, high-quality model development with robust support for data processing, feature engineering, model selection, and deployment.
You will provide expert support to users (data scientists from MATS teams and traders) by leveraging your comprehensive understanding of the frameworks developed in the team. You will facilitate their work by clearly presenting the features and guiding them to fully utilize the capabilities of the frameworks, ensuring they can maximize their potential.
You will collaborate with key partner teams (e.g. Algo Strategies, Modelling & Analysis) to co-develop specialized tools, ensuring flexibility for researchers while maintaining core architectural standards.
You will work on a variety of different problems related to energy and commodity markets and acquire business knowledge.



Your key responsibilities will include:


Taking ownership of the products and helping implement processes to guarantee a successful deployment.
Be conscientious of and promote best development practices to ensure quality and robustness of usage.
Create accompanying applications (such as for interactive visualization and simulations) to facilitate user understanding and interaction with the core frameworks.
Ensure adherence to the product life cycle, including all phases from initial concept through to product release and post-release activities.
Test and integrate advanced techniques and quantitative algorithms, with a focus on continuous improvement.
Oversee the frameworks, monitor performance (both in terms of results and computational efficiency), and proactively implement enhancements based on analytical findings.
Ensure comprehensive documentation is created and maintained for all frameworks, to guide users in utilizing these applications effectively.
Frequently communicate with the core teams of MATS and trading desks to ensure solid business knowledge, understanding of trading desk activities, challenges, and pain points.



Profil du candidat


You are a talented individual with a strong technical or engineering background. A PhD in Computer Science or Physics is an advantage.
You are a continuous learner with a strong team spirit, always seeking to improve and innovate beyond the status quo. An individual who demonstrates the ability to adapt and successfully collaborate with colleagues from di-verse backgrounds, and likes proactively sharing acquired knowledge.
5+ years of proven experience in software development and/or maintenance, and working with large code-bases. Must be able to write scalable, well-tested and well-documented code that adheres to best practices, and is pre-pared for future use cases. Experience debugging and safe refactoring legacy code is required.
You show a strong understanding of Data Science, ML, and algorithmic methods, with demonstrated experience working with a diverse array of algorithms (time series forecasting, AutoML, constrained optimization, matching, anomaly detection, etc.). Experience in developing quantitative algorithms is an advantage.
You have interest or familiarity with energy and commodities markets, and ability to develop appropriate algorithms (use cases such as backtesting, portfolio optimization, physical and financial assets pricing, dispatch optimization, etc.)
Mindset to design extensible and reusable code according to business needs.
Experience with product cycle (development, validation, deployment).
Experience with cloud computing, DevOps/MLOps best practices, CI/CD, and containerization.
Knowledge of relational and non-relational databases (SQL, MongoDB).
Clear and effective communication skills for reporting and collaboration.
You are fluent in English or French native/fluent speaker with an advanced English level.



Additional and advantageous requirements:


Experience with concurrent programming (multiprocessing, multithreading, gpu-acceleration).
Demonstrated contributions to open-source projects.
Experience with AWS and Databricks.



Informations suppl√©mentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversit√©, promeut le d√©veloppement individuel et offre des opportunit√©s d'emploi √©gales √† tous les candidats.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (W/M)
Description:
About The Swiss Data Science Center (SDSC)

The Swiss Data Science Center (SDSC) is a strategic focus area of the ETH domain, with EPFL and ETH Zurich as founding partners, developing into a National Research Infrastructure in 2025. Its mission is to support academic labs, hospitals, industry and public sector stakeholders, including cantonal and federal administrations, through their entire data science journey, from the collection and management of data to machine learning, AI, and industrialization. With a large multidisciplinary team of professionals across three locations (Lausanne, Zurich, Villigen), the SDSC provides expertise and services to various domains, such as health and biomedical sciences, energy and sustainability, climate and environment, and large-scale scientific infrastructures. More: www.datascience.ch

The Research team is responsible for research collaborations in the academic and public sector. See https://datascience.ch/academic-projects/ for an idea of some of our academic research collaborations.

Mission

As a Senior Data Scientist working in the Research team of the Swiss Data Science Center, you will use your expertise in machine learning, statistical data science, computer vision, natural language processing, and signal processing to work closely with researchers, experts and other collaborators from academia or the public sector in Switzerland, working in various fields, such as health and biomedical sciences, climate and environment, energy and sustainability, physical and engineering sciences, and digital society. You will help them identify how to analyze or model their data to answer precise scientific questions or develop algorithms that perform automatically some challenging tasks.

This typically involves exchanging actively with collaborators and domain experts to understand the precise desiderata of the project, translating them into data science terms, determining which approaches and formulations are most effective to achieve the desired goals, implement the corresponding algorithms, perform the evaluations hand-in-hand with the domain experts, and eventually release open-source code and the associated documentation, write research papers or technical reports as appropriate, and contribute to the communication of the results.

Main Duties And Responsibilities Include


Working on data science projects with collaborators from the academic and public sector.


You Will Also Contribute To


Advising MSc Students.
Evaluating project proposals.


Profile

The Ideal Candidate


Holds a PhD in machine learning, statistics, computer vision, natural language processing, signal processing, or optimization.
Has practical experience in using machine learning models in concrete applications.
Has experience in interdisciplinary collaborations and of real-world applications is desirable.
Is proficient in Python, PyTorch, and familiar with state-of-the-art models and architectures.


We offer


A stimulating, collaborative, cross-disciplinary environment in a world-class research institution, where you will be part of a team of 40 data scientists from more than 15 different countries. We all work towards applying and developing novel ML methods to solve real-world problems.
We value work-life balance.
You will be able to publish your research in collaboration with experts from different fields in top-ranked journals and conferences.
You will have the opportunity to help supervise student projects.
We encourage experimentation and creativity by actively promoting learning of new technologies and approaches on the job.
Your opinion will always matter.


Informations

Contract Start Date : 01/10/2025

Activity Rate : 100.00

Contract Type: CDD

Duration: 1 year renewable

Reference: 1731

Contact

Please note that we exclusively accept applications submitted through our online application portal. Applications via email or postal services will not be considered.

Questions regarding the position should be directed to Mathieu Salzmann (mathieu.salzmann@epfl.ch) or Guillaume Obozinski (guillaume.obozinski@sdsc.ethz.ch) (no applications).

We would like to point out that the pre-selection is carried out by the responsible recruiters and not by artificial intelligence.

Title: Research Scientist, Synthetic Data Generation
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


PhD degree in Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience programming with Python.
Experience with large language models.
Having published papers (being listed as author) at conferences (e.g., NIPS, ICML, ACL, CVPR, etc).


Preferred qualifications:


First author publications at target conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, ACL, NAACL, EMNLP, USENIX Security, IEEE S&P, ACM CCS) in the field of synthetic data generation.
Experience in designing, implementing, and scaling AI systems, with a focus on beam-like pipelines.
Experience in designing and developing high-quality user/developer-facing Application programming interfaces (APIs).
Significant research experience with LLMs and understanding of their capabilities and limitations.
Proven track record of delivering AI models, tools, or frameworks.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills for effective collaboration with partners.


About The Job

As an organization, Google maintains a portfolio of research projects driven by fundamental research, new product innovation, product contribution and infrastructure goals, while providing individuals and teams the freedom to emphasize specific types of work. As a Research Scientist, you'll setup large-scale tests and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly, managing deadlines and deliverables while applying the latest theories to develop new and improved products, processes, or technologies. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, our research scientists work on real-world problems that span the breadth of computer science, such as machine (and deep) learning, data mining, natural language processing, hardware and software performance analysis, improving compilers for mobile platforms, as well as core search and much more.

As a Research Scientist, you'll also actively contribute to the wider research community by sharing and publishing your findings, with ideas inspired by internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world.

Google Research is building the next generation of intelligent systems for all Google products. To achieve this, we‚Äôre working on projects that utilize the latest computer science techniques developed by skilled software developers and research scientists. Google Research teams collaborate closely with other teams across Google, maintaining the flexibility and versatility required to adapt new projects and foci that meet the demands of the world's fast-paced business needs.

Responsibilities


Develop and evaluate novel algorithms for various synthetic data generation, across modalities (text, images, audio, etc.)
Design and conduct experiments to assess the quality and effectiveness of synthetic data in training and evaluating AI models.
Use beam-like pipelines to handle massive datasets and enable efficient data generation at scale.
Stay up-to-date with the latest research in Large Language Models (LLMs) and synthetic data.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Why should I Apply:

At Sonar, we‚Äôre a group of brilliant, motivated, and driven professionals working hard to help organizations build responsible, secure, high-quality code quickly and systematically. We build solutions that don‚Äôt just solve symptoms of problems ‚Äì we fix problems at the source ‚Äì source code, to be specific.

We have a dynamic culture with employees worldwide and hub offices in the USA, Switzerland, the UK, Singapore, and Germany. We believe team members should have the opportunity to come to work every day, work on a product they are proud of, love what they do, and feel energized by their peers. With our roots deep in the open source community, we‚Äôre all about the mission: provide solutions that deliver Clean Code.

The Impact You Will Have:

As a member of the Product Data team, you will support our Product-led Growth (PLG) team and use data to understand how people use our products. You will work closely with the Product-led Growth team on insights coming from our cloud and on-premises product, formulate metrics and find ways to improve the user experience. Your analysis will directly help us make the product better, get more users, and keep them engaged.

What You Will Do Daily:


Put in place PLG recurrent analytics, including defining the key metrics related to customer success and developing the corresponding tools (e.g. dashboards) for regular monitoring.
Analyze user behavior to understand how they sign up, use features, and why they stay or leave.
Identify main areas of opportunity (e.g. points of new user drop-off)
Use SQL and Python to work with datasets from our product.
Build and manage dashboards in Tableau to track important metrics for the team.
Use product analytics tools to find opportunities to improve the product.
Share what you learn from data with the team to help them make better decisions.


The Experience You Will Need:


5 years+ of experience as a Data Scientist
Previous experience in PLG preferred
Strong SQL and Python skills for data analysis (including libraries like Pandas and NumPy).
Experience with product analytics methods like funnel and cohort analysis.
Familiarity with product analytics tools (e.g., Amplitude, Mixpanel, Heap).
Experience building dashboards in Tableau or a similar visualization tool.
Good communication skills and the ability to explain data clearly to different audiences.
Curiosity and an interest in how data can help a product succeed.


Why you will love it here:


Our culture and mission set us apart. We have a dynamic work culture that values respect and kindness ‚Äì and embraces the right to fail (and get right back up again!). We believe that the best idea wins and everyone has a voice.
We believe that great people make a great company. We value people skills as much as technical skills and strive to keep things friendly and laid-back while still being passionate leaders in our domains. Our 550+ SonarSourcers from 33 different nationalities can relate!
We embrace work-life balance. It is important to maintain a healthy work-life balance. This is why we have a flexible work policy that includes remote and in-office hybrid work (minimum three days a week in the office - Monday/Tuesday/Thursday).
We have a growth mindset. We love to learn and believe that continuous education is critical to our success. In an ever-changing industry, new skills are a must, and we're happy to help our team acquire them.


We prioritize Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:

At Sonar, we are a global workforce and recognize the value of different backgrounds, and global cultures.

We are committed to creating a diverse work environment and are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

All offers of employment at Sonar are contingent upon the clear results of a comprehensive background check conducted prior to the start date.

Please note that applications submitted through agencies or third-party recruiters will not be considered.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Swarovski, where innovation meets inspiration, our people desire to explore, experience and create. As a Data Scientist you will get a chance to work in a rewarding role within a diverse team that is pushing boundaries. Be part of a truly iconic global brand, learn and grow with us. We‚Äôre bold and inventive, revealing astonishing things like no one else can. A world of wonder awaits you.

About The Job

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:


Designing and developing quantitative and generative AI assets by translating business problems and requirements into actionable insights
Partnering with other Business Functions to align with market state-of-the-art solutions and identify Advanced Analytics opportunities to be embedded the existing processes
Developing data science products ensuring business improvements are impactful and aligned to the company objectives and strategy, including appropriate and structured documentation of the methodology and data used
Leverage the Data Lake information and cloud infrastructure as well as the current technology landscape to design the solutions
Selecting features, building and optimizing models using Machine Learning and other Advanced Analytics techniques
Coordinating with the Innovation reference people to identify suitable processes for AI agents, analyze them and develop AI Agents use cases
Presenting results and insights to business and driving the conversation about innovation directions in the Advanced Analytics space


About You

We are looking for a unique and amazing talent, who brings along the following:


University degree/ Education, preferably in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics or similar
Minimum 3 years of professional experience in a similar role within an international setting
Proficiency in Python and/or R, modelling & real-time analytics, database languages (e.g., SQL), big data frameworks, and Cloud platforms (e.g. Google Cloud Platform, Azure, AWS)
Deep understanding of Generative AI models their implementation in business settings
Previous experience with AI Agents (e.g. GCP Agent builder) is a plus
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Team orientation and ability to work and interface effectively with all levels of the organization
Excellent English proficiency, presentation and communication skills


What We Offer

You can expect a range of benefits, including:


Swarovski products discounts
Full coverage of accident insurance
Attractive pension fund conditions
Subsidized public transportation or free parking
Employee canteen with buffet


Masters of Light Since 1895

Swarovski creates beautiful crystal-based products of impeccable quality and craftsmanship that bring joy and celebrate individuality.

Founded in 1895 in Austria, the company designs, manufactures and sells the world's finest crystal, gemstones, Swarovski Created Diamonds and zirconia, jewelry, and accessories, as well as crystal objects and home accessories. Swarovski Crystal Business has a global reach with approximately 2,400 stores and 6,700 points of sales in around 140 countries and employs more than 18,000 people. Together with its sister companies Swarovski Optik (optical devices) and Tyrolit (abrasives), Swarovski Crystal Business forms the Swarovski Group. A responsible relationship with people and the planet is part of Swarovski‚Äôs heritage. Today this legacy is rooted in sustainability measures across the value chain, with an emphasis on circular innovation, championing diversity, inclusion and self-expression, and in the philanthropic work of the Swarovski Foundation, which supports charitable organizations bringing positive environmental and social impact.

Swarovski is an equal opportunity employer. We give our people the guts to celebrate individuality and pride ourselves on creating a workplace where people feel involved, respected, valued, connected, and heard. A place where anyone/everyone belongs. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under the law of the countries we operate in.

Title: AI/ML Engineering Lead
Description:
About us :







Entirely is building the first open, AI-powered ecosystem for Tailored Marketing at Scale ‚Äî enabling enterprise teams to orchestrate campaigns, channels, and content with unprecedented automation, personalization, and efficiency. Headquartered in Zug, Switzerland, we bring together portfolio companies, strategic technology partners, and leading academic institutions to address the complexity and fragmentation of the global marketing technology landscape. Entirely.ai is the dedicated home for AI experiments within Entirely to explore bold ideas, test breakthrough capabilities, and translate emerging research into viable enterprise solutions. Our mission is to co-create a scalable, defensible business model in collaboration with our founding partners, other ecosystem players, and leading universities such as ETH Zurich. From rapid prototypes to production-ready pilots, we turn concepts into solutions that can transform the way enterprise marketing teams operate.




We are looking for an AI/ML Engineering Lead to architect and guide the technical evolution of this initiative. In this role, you will lead a multidisciplinary engineering team ‚Äî including LLM experts, ML engineers, and full-stack developers ‚Äî and work closely with our product, design, and research counterparts. You will own the transition from rapid ‚Äúvibe coding‚Äù prototypes to secure, scalable, enterprise-grade AI systems, ensuring our solutions meet both cutting-edge performance goals and rigorous business requirements. Much like a technical leader in a hyperscale AI organization, you will navigate between research innovation and enterprise delivery ‚Äî balancing fast experimentation with the discipline of building something robust, maintainable, and production-ready. You will work hands-on with models and pipelines in the early days, but also design the infrastructure, processes, and standards that enable the team to scale impact across the ecosystem.




Your Mission:




Lead and expand a high-caliber engineering team, fostering a culture of technical excellence, collaboration, and continuous learning.
Co-define the AI/ML tech stack, architecture, and infrastructure in close alignment with the CTO and group-wide enterprise architects.
Own the transition from rapid prototyping to a production-grade AI/ML environment, balancing speed with scalability, security, and maintainability.
Collaborate with product managers, designers, and researchers to translate product concepts into AI-driven features that deliver tangible business impact.
Prototype and evaluate AI/ML models for NLP, content generation, classification, recommendation, and other relevant marketing use cases.
Design and implement robust data pipelines for collection, preprocessing, model training, evaluation, and deployment.
Establish MLOps best practices: experiment tracking, model versioning, CI/CD for ML, automated testing, and monitoring.
Ensure AI solutions comply with governance, ethical, and security requirements.
Occasionally represent Entirely.ai at conferences, industry meetups, and on our blog, acting as a thought leader in AI/ML engineering.







Your Profile:




Master‚Äôs degree or PhD in Computer Science, AI/ML, Data Science, or a related technical field; ability to digest and apply research findings quickly.
Proven experience in AI/ML engineering or applied research, with strong foundations in data structures and algorithms.
Proven track record in technical leadership, ideally in AI/ML-heavy environments.
Advanced proficiency in Python and experience with TypeScript or similar languages.
Deep knowledge of AI/ML frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face Transformers) and model deployment workflows.
Strong experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
Solid understanding of NLP techniques and/or multimodal AI systems; LLM integration and orchestration experience is a strong plus.
Experience with MLOps tooling (MLflow, Weights & Biases, or similar) and best practices for enterprise AI delivery.
Familiarity with data privacy regulations, AI ethics, and responsible AI principles.
Excellent communication skills ‚Äî able to translate technical complexity into clear strategic decisions.
Willing to travel occasionally to our Zug office (e.g. up to 2 days/week) for key workshops and team alignment.
Fluent in English.
















Working With us Means?




You will join a high-ambition, low-ego environment where innovation meets the real-world complexity of enterprise marketing. As part of the DuMont Media Group ‚Äî with roots tracing back to the 17th century and today calling itself a ‚Äòstartup with over 400 years of tradition‚Äô ‚Äî we combine the speed of a startup with the network and resources of an established group. We are still at the beginning of our journey, which means you will have significant creative leeway to shape what we do and leave a visible impact from day one. This is also an opportunity to work at the forefront of agentic AI, applying it to a domain where the next paradigm shift is already taking shape.




Direct collaboration with world-class AI researchers and experienced industry partners.
Competitive salary, performance-based incentives.
Opportunities for professional growth, with direct access to executive mentors, investor networks, and cutting-edge AI research.
Flexible working hours, hybrid work options, and a modern office in Zug, with regular collaboration days in Zurich and remote work possibilities.
Team events and game nights ‚Äî from hiking in the Swiss Alps to table soccer, lunch & learns, and board games.
English as our default language, plus snackable (Swiss-)German lessons from local colleagues.
A diverse, international, and collaborative culture that values initiative, openness, and delivering tangible results.
Optional relocation assistance for internationals.

  • Direct collaboration with world-class AI researchers and experienced industry partners.
  • Competitive salary, performance-based incentives.
  • Opportunities for professional growth, with direct access to executive mentors, investor networks, and cutting-edge AI research.
  • Flexible working hours, hybrid work options, and a modern office in Zug, with regular collaboration days in Zurich and remote work possibilities.
  • Team events and game nights ‚Äî from hiking in the Swiss Alps to table soccer, lunch & learns, and board games.
  • English as our default language, plus snackable (Swiss-)German lessons from local colleagues.
